CommentsContent: I bought this while searching for a STACK record player like my wonderful old Sears SILVERTONE 1957 record player that could play 16's, 45's, 33's and 78's, had great speakers and was portable!!  It is still working somewhat, but I felt it was ready to go after all these years. I bought this record player until I find a GOOD STACK record player.  Other than only playing ONE record at a time, the BIG problem is the dumb cover!!!  It does not close completely when playing 33's, and my CATS started to "ride" the record, so I had to move it into my closed-off sewing room. I DO NOT care at all about the blue tooth, and found it does NOT work! Also the record speed numbers are VERY hard to read and should be in RED.  I knew it would not play STACKS, but did think the cover closed. NO>>>I AM NOT PLEASED, but am keeping it because I cannot find what I really want at the moment. I'll just wait until GOOD STACK record players come out again to buy another. Well, it was cheap and does part of the job for right now. I sure hope to find a great stack player later with a large top that I can move from room to room as I did my old one. I have NO interest in "blue tooth", but I am INTERESTED in quality. This is not a bad player for a newbie or someone without cats, but it sure is time-consuming to change records constantly when doing housework!!

CommentsTitle: Need a record player and not spend a lot? This one is it!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2019
CommentsContent: The Victrola Vintage is not the best record player out there. But if you need a functional record player with an aesthetic appeal and a no-nonsense design, then this is your unit. I purchased this for my 14-year-old son, who loves music. He instantly took to the marvel of how the records work and uses it regularly to listen to old records. The speakers are not the greatest but you do have an option to connect to better ones via RCA cable. All in all a great buy for the price! I am only giving it 3 stars because comparatively to other units out there, this one is in the middle. Great starter deck though!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2020
CommentsContent: If you're looking to play records and don't particularly care too much for good sound quality, then this turntable is for you. Don't let self-proclaimed turntable 'experts' steer you away from this novelty purchase, or make you feel bad for already owning one. This is a perfect novelty record player that plenty of newcomers can enjoy to start off their journey into this side of the music world. In the end, records are meant to be played. Enjoy them while you can.My recommendations:-Purchase a diamond needle to replace the stock one it comes with. Don't worry, it's easily replaceable. The needle it comes with is very low-quality and has a high chance to skip and sound 'hissy'.-If you plan on wanting good sound out of this thing, purchase some powered speakers. That partially ruins the 'portability' gimmick, but not by much.How's it feel?-It feels well constructed. It doesn't feel luxurious, mind you, but it also doesn't feel extremely cheap.How's the setup?-Easy. It's all set up and good to go, right out of the box. Practically plug-and-play.Hows the sound quality?-Bad. Lol. It's very 'tinny' and lacks depth. Bass is imperceptible. Mids and highs sound okay. The same can be said no matter if you're using the speakers or the headphone output. That's what should be expected at this price range. It can get very loud however, which is a good thing. It can fill a medium room with its loudness.How's the bluetooth?-Fine. Works as it should. Easy to connect. No problems so far.How's the portability?Good. It's got the body of a suitcase! Perfectly portable in that regard. One complaint I have however, is the fact that it doesn't have some sort of battery it runs off of. It *needs* to be plugged in. So its portability is only useful if you've got an outlet to plug it into.

CommentsTitle: ***Multiple broken units in a row, buy something else
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 13, 2018
CommentsContent: These things are nothing but junk. I order two of them. The first one had a bent turntable that ruined a few records. The second had a turntable that didn't even work and came in a smashed box with nothing to protect the item from shifting around. In not sure who is in charge of qquality control or testing these items. But someone needs to do better. Would have really liked to own a working unit, but at this point these things will only be regarded as trash

CommentsTitle: Super cute, functional design with good quality sound, easy to use
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2021
CommentsContent: I got this as a Christmas gift for my parents who have a decent record collection but haven’t owned a record player in ages! The outer design is super cute and I love the different color options, and the overall size is just right, not to big, not too small. Setup was very easy. The design of the mechanism itself is simple to use and seems to work really well with both the smaller 45s and the larger standard sized records that we tried with it. It has settings for 3 different types of records. The sound quality for both the actual records and the Bluetooth option were excellent, but is not overly bassy. The volume is more than loud enough to enjoy listening to in the same room or from another. Overall we had SUCH a nice time listening to old records and making new memories with this Victrola, and I highly recommend this product for folks of all ages looking for an affordable and easy way to listen to their records!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2019
CommentsContent: This gorgeous record player is WORTH EVERY CENT!I have previously purchased a record player for my father in law and it was garbage. The speakers were crap, the built in radio was cute but impractical. We had to purchase giant speakers and hardwire them into his record player just to get a decent volume.And I'm not exaggerating when I say this, the built in speakers in this record player are much better than the 150$ two we bought for his dads record player. I was shocked about how clear and loud it all is, but in balance. The music doesnt get thin, and you dont lose the base layers of the music when you turn the volume up, it is all equalized extremely well.It's cute, it looks very vintage, it plays very nicely and smoothly, and I love the lowering lever on the arm, because I am notorious for dragging the needle on my records and I'm glad it's VERY precise now.I'm buying one for my mum and brother, and I will never purchase another record player if it isn't a Victrola. They know what they're doing, and care about their work and sound quality!

CommentsTitle: Only worked a few times & the warranty is a joke!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 6, 2019
CommentsContent: Dead after 9 months and only a few uses. Plugged it in to use tonight and smoke came out of the machine, smelled like burning plastic, wouldn't turn on.ETA: We had purchased the additional warranty with this product. We submitted that and it was refused because apparently the additional warranty protection is only good AFTER the manufacturer warranty of one year. We have been emailing back and forth with the manufacturer providing forms and receipts as requested only for them to tell us that WE are responsible to mail the unit across the country with an additional printed copy of the receipt. This would cost half the cost of the unit!This is ridiculous hoop jumping and cost to the customer.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 13, 2018
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   Do not buy for your main record player if you’re really getting into vinyls! Now that I’ve said that, this is a great little record player for moving around the house or taking with you on trips. I bought this for our bedroom, and to use on our patio, and the sound is really good, but nothing like our main turntable that is powered by a receiver through a home theater system, so do not go into purchasing this with crazy expectations. We love ours and I’m glad I bought it. Bought a warehouse deal and it was in perfect condition, although they did ship it in it’s original box with no protection.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2020
CommentsContent: So, as a young boy and then teenager, this type of record player was the go-to device everyone had. When I plugged this one in, at first, I was a little disappointed in the sound. But after trying a few other 45's, it seemed better. I had forgotten that 45 pressings can vary from label to label when it comes to sound.  I then tried a 33 size and the sound was even better. Don't expect great quality sound, but DO expect ease of use and a quality built product. It's handy to just pull out and put on something you haven't heard for years. I did so, and the record jolted me back 65 years to the last time I heard the song!  And it was great to hear it again.  Note, this was the SECOND one I tried. The first one was dead on arrival and I have to send it back. So glad this second one worked well.  Very well-priced, decent product; just not deluxe sound or bass.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 20, 2018
CommentsContent: So for the price, I guess it's ok. I've read some horror stories about how eventually this player will wear down your vinyl, so I was wary of that. The purple color with the rose gold hardware is very cute. The speakers are kind of terrible, but that's to be expected. My main problem was with the sound quality, even when connected to nicer speakers.I hooked this up to my soundbar and listened to a record. The sound was kind of rough and wobbly. I then played the same record on a vintage turntable and it sounded 10 times better, removing all the noise and strengthening the overall sound. Then I played it on an Audio-Technica turntable and again, the sound was even better. I decided it was worth a little more money to get a turntable that sounds better and has less of a chance of wrecking my records. Admittedly I'm not super concerned about damage over time to my records, since I don't buy expensive vinyl and mostly purchase from thrift stores, but it was still something to consider.The sound just doesn't compare. If you really don't care about sound quality, record longevity, or just want something that will play records and look cute and vintage, by all means grab one of these. The price is good for a trendy piece of home decor.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2017
CommentsContent: I was super excited to get this as a relatively affordable turntable. I paid for 2 day shipping but received it in 4 days. When I finally got it, I set everything up, placed my record, moved the needle into position annnnd nothing. Figured the belt came loose during shipping so I checked and reset it, still nothing. The table wouldn't even turn. I went through everything again just to be sure I didn't miss anything. Still no action. I figure the motor was bad. I checked the bluetooth feature to see how it sounded and a majority of the reviews are right, the speakers sound terrible. Not worth my time, I will be returning this and getting a Audio-Technica one. Just should've spent the money on a nicer one.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2020
CommentsContent: I got this for my dad for Christmas. He LOVES it. He kept saying he couldn’t believe I found one (a record player) because he’d been seeing vinyls popping up in stores everywhere but couldn’t find a player. It’s easy for him to fold up and put away when the grandkids come over. He also liked that he can hook it up to his phone and listen to Pandora. AND it’s loud enough that he can play it in his bedroom and hear it in the kitchen.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 19, 2020
CommentsContent: Growing up, my family acquired a pretty hefty cache of LPs. Aside from the usual arsenal everyone acquired in the 70s and early-mid 80s, at one point, my elementary school closed down, and the principal decided to give away the entire music library of the school (considerable) to anyone who wanted it. For no reason other than the sheer joy of taking something from the school, I hauled away armload after armload of records which have sat in my mom's basement for about 40 years, well preserved but also unlistened-to. A few weeks ago I was on the phone with her and she lamented the fact she no longer had a record-player, because she had a yen to listen to old records. I immediately went into Amazon and had this player sent to her house. I am pleased to announce she loves it. She loves the bright color of the case, loves that it is portable and can be played anywhere in the house (unlike the hefty systems of the past), and tells me the sound quality is quite good. She even noted that it reminds he strongly of the players she herself grew up with, so there's a nostalgia factor.All in all I think that this was a great buy. I haven't yet had a chance to try it out for myself but moms was happy and since she spent the first 40-odd years of her life listening to LPs and 45s, I think her standards have to be respected. I will add a report of my own the next time I visit, but for now I give this five stars. It does the job it is supposed to do, and for a very reasonable price.

CommentsTitle: Good overall, but could use a few tweeks
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2020
CommentsContent: The sound quality coming out of this when playing a record is phenomenal!That being said, using the speakers via Bluetooth connection is absolutely worthless.  Playing music directly from my phone's speaker is indescribably louder than playing via Bluetooth through the record player's speakers, even at full volume.  I thought the Bluetooth feature was to transfer the record's sound to another device, which would be awesome, though obviously unlikely.

CommentsTitle: You get what you pay for
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 18, 2019
CommentsContent: I had jumped off the vinyl train several years ago, but lately I got some 7" singles that have songs I can't find elsewhere, and decided I should probably get a turntable so I could actually hear them. If you are looking for something to occasionally play old records on, and don't care that much about superb sound quality, this is a decent choice. It plays just fine, but the speakers GREATLY limit the bass. If you are an audiophile and really care about great sound quality, be prepared to dish out a lot more money (and if you're buying new records, you should be able to afford that). So, for a 'beginner',or someone who just wants to pull out a record every so often, this is a nice affordable choice (the one I got was just a little over $30).

CommentsTitle: JUNK and no response from customer servicec
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2019
CommentsContent: Worked a week, then speed was erratic.  Contacted manufacturer under warranty and they require $10 to look at it. They asked for receipt and then never responded again.  You get what you pay for I guess, thanks for the junk record player and NO customer service.  Buyer beware.

CommentsTitle: Don't waist your time or money on this!!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2019
CommentsContent: Terrible product. First one that came in was defective and came with a power cord that was rusted and had exposed wires. When I got my replacement the box was damaged, the top of the record player wasn't screwed in and worst of all the spinner bounces around and causes records to not play properly.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2018
CommentsContent: Great product especially for the price. Very pleased with condition since it was well protected. Works flawlessly without any problems. The sound from the speakers are clear from using records. When using bluetooth (BT as it's abbreviated on device) it doesn't sound as great as it should so that could improve a tad bit. Maybe adding more bass into the speakers will make it improve better. As a whole, it worth the value.

CommentsTitle: It is what I wanted it to be!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 13, 2021
CommentsContent: When I was 25, some idiot my husband (at the time) knew and apparently owed money to broke into our house and stole my entire record collection that I had been building since I was 12. I never got any of the records back, and I divorced the loser husband, but for many years, I went without records. Eventually I had cassettes, and then CDs, and then computers/phone playlists. But I never forgot all those records, and they were such a HUGE part of some of my best memories, and a whole soundtrack to my life that was missing, so that I began to wish I had those records again. I just wanted an easy to use record player that didn't take up too much space, didn't cost too much, and was nice looking. This one checked all the boxes. It sounds decent, although I did end  up buying external speakers for it but I could have done without them, I just wanted to be able to turn my music up a little more if I choose to do that. I think it's beautiful, and the wood feels good. Everything was there and worked perfectly. I am completely satisfied, and really looking forward to building my record collection back. It looks like I can't afford any of the many, many albums I had originally, they are apparently collector's items now and most of them have prices in the triple digits these days instead of the handful of dollars I paid for them back in the day. But I love music and I am building up a new collection, now. It's having a major healing effect. I am thankful for this record player starting all of that.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 10, 2020
CommentsContent: I was concerned because of many of the negative reviews on here, but I really like the Victrola portable suitcase record player. First of all, the sound is great. I have played vinyl records and songs from my phone using the Bluetooth feature, and the sound is actually pretty loud. The speakers don't sound tinny. The only downside is that there's not too much bass, but you could hook up more high quality speakers, but I don't feel the need to do so. This record player's sound quality is much better than a Jensen record player I had a while back.I also like that there is a knob to switch between Bluetooth, Line In, and Phonograph. The light even changes color to indicate which mode you're on. My phone easily connected to the record player via Bluetooth, and the sound quality is excellent.Lastly, the look of the record player is really great. The material doesn't feel cheap, and the turquoise color really pops. The suitcase look is very vintage. I highly recommend this record player.

CommentsTitle: Buy it if you don’t actually intend to listen to records on it.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2021
CommentsContent: I got this record as a Christmas present and if I wrote my review on day 1, I would have been raving about it. It looks adorable, it was easy to set up for a beginner and for the first few days worked just fine. However, I started to notice my record skipping, in parts sounding like it’s on slo-mo and instead of looking flat as it spun..would look like it was on a wave.Naturally, I thought it was the record I purchased so I brought it back to the shop. When they tested the record on their record player, the three above-mentioned issues were resolved. The store owner asked me if I had a Victrola or Crosley record player with built-in speakers. He explained that this happens commonly with these record players and that often, they do a number on the records themselves. What a disappointment. Also, FYI: (this has nothing to do with the rating, purely an FYI) The volume is fit for a medium to large room, it won’t fill a floor of your home with music and definitely not a house full of guests.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 28, 2020
CommentsContent: I received some records and wanted a player with built in speakers and this was perfect!  It worked well for the 3 times I played it and when i went to use it again nothing happened!  I had set it up in its home so I hadn't moved it I just plugged it back in.  It seemed not to get power and when I tried a different adapter it lasted for like 30 seconds.  I really enjoyed this while it worked so I'm taking a chance on a replacement and if that fails its a total return.Update May 6 2020They didn't replace the item they fixed the one I had and sent it back in the box I sent but didn't reseal it.  I'm amazed it got to me with everything inside.  Let's see how long this lasts.

CommentsTitle: Love the crackle and pop of vinyl!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2021
CommentsContent: My husband and I inherited a huge box of vinyl records but had no way to play them. Ordered this Victrola and couldn't be happier!! I was eagerly awaiting delivery and had this bad boy unboxed, and opened playing records in under 10 minutes! The packaging was done with care to protect the player during shipping. The instructions were super easy to read and understand. I literally have had it in my possession for less than 30 minutes so I have yet to try out any of the other features like bluetooth connectivity, but honestly i don't plan on using it for that. So, if you are looking for a great portable record player with easy operating instructions this is the one for you! I love it!! It even came with an extra replacement needle, and a built in 45 RPM adaptor. It has 3 speed capabilities and an auto stop option.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2020
CommentsContent: This is my second record player from Victoria.  The first was a Christmas gift, and I excitedly put on a brand new record...and it skipped.  I tried an old record...skipped.  It skipped on every record I tried.So, I returned it.  I ordered a DIFFERENT record player, it was so shoddy, and felt so cheap that I returned THAT one.  But, at least it played my records in full.Then I started researching.  I’m not enthusiastic enough to spend over $100, so I started searching for “best record players under $100” and this one was the TOP of multiple lists.  I figured my first one was a fluke, so I tried again. And SURPRISE, I have the exact same issue.  And even when it does play, the static is wild, and if I turn the volume up too high the sound starts to distort.

CommentsTitle: A great turntable at a great price!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2018
CommentsContent: This thing is great! The output is great. Very loud and clear with no distortion. I put the first record on it this morning and the audio quality and overall functionality is awesome. It also makes a great bluetooth speaker as well. The briefcase design makes it great for moving it room to room or traveling places with it. I highly recommend this turntable to both the beginner who's looking to get into vinyl and even the hardcore collector that's just looking for something more portable with some good sound!

CommentsTitle: The bluetooth feature is misleading, poor sound quality
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2019
CommentsContent: Buying a "bluetooth turntable", you'd assume that the "bluetooth" feature would allow you to stream the record player to another bluetooth speaker or headset, right? Nope! The "Bluetooth features" on this mean you can send things from your phone to the speaker on this turntable. Even if the speakers on this turntable were good, this wouldn't make much sense, but the speakers on this turntable are trash, so it's a completely asinine feature.I cannot recommend this product.

CommentsTitle: Good quality and super fast shipping
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 7, 2018
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   Despite all the bad reviews, I decided to go ahead and buy this because it was the cheapest one I could find. I was actually very pleasantly surprised. I ordered it yesterday and received it in the mail today. The color is correct & nothing is broken or malfunctioning so far. The sound quality is actually pretty nice and I haven’t heard and crackling or squeaking no matter how high I turn the volume up. I haven’t tried the Bluetooth functionality yet but I’ll update my review when I do.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 16, 2019
CommentsContent: I really wanted to love this. My daughter was so excited to get this for Christmas. Authentically, we had little techie errors from day one. The cord was finicky, the record arm was also finicky. We didn’t return it because my husband is handy and it was easy to fix here and there for our family but I wouldn’t recommend it to someone who doesn’t have that skill. The sound quality was ok, however, I have a portable Bluetooth speaker at home that has better sound quality and output that I paid half the price for. She stopped using the record player because it skipped constantly (even after we replaced the little end piece) and uses it strictly for the speaker to play music from her phone. It’s still a good looking piece for her room so she’s kept it but I will be purchasing another brand in the future for the record player option. I would give it 2-3 stars

CommentsTitle: Bluetooth connection NOT DESIGNED to transmit sound from record player to external speaker
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 4, 2020
CommentsContent: The Bluetooth function does NOT allow you to play a record through an external bluetooth speaker. You can only use the record player's speakers to INPUT music from an external source, and the record player's sound quality is lower than a typical iPhone. Not knowing this, after unpacking unit, I switched it to Bluetooth and paired with my iPhone. The turntable stopped and music from my iPhone playlist began (faintly) playing through the record player.  Thought it was broken until I read another review from a few days ago and realized that you CANNOT USE THIS to transmit music FROM the record player TO an external bluetooth speaker. (might work with AUX cord, haven't tried).  The product description (obliquely) says so but I didn't catch this before buying.  I will keep it as it's cute and only purchased to play some very old childhood records that have sentimental value only.

CommentsTitle: Alright record player, solid Bluetooth speaker
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 21, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this refurbished by the seller, which came out to be essentially like new. The sound quality on the phonograph is alright. It plays records in a lofi sound quality, but it's still perfectly fine listening to it. If you're into listening to your records in the highest quality possible, you already aren't looking to buy this. This product is aimed at people who simply want to have an inexpensive way to listen to records, or even to get into the hobby.The build quality is alright. I'm not taking it traveling, so I'm not to worried about it holding up to force. Mine was pretty tough to get to the insides for tinkering. I had to take a razor blade to split the seams enough to lift the wooden panel up. The tonearm on mine came down pretty fast, which threw me off since the same model I replaced with this had its tonearm take a comfortably slow lowering to records. I had to add Elmer's glue to the tonearm mechanism to get it to ease on the speed, and now it falls much softer.What really surprised me about this player was the Bluetooth functionality. It's an okay phonograph, but a surprisingly amazing sounding Bluetooth speaker. With the lid closed, I was shocked how good music sounded from its built in speakers. The speakers don't really do records justice, but with Spotify and YouTube connected to it through it from my phone, it's a full, high quality sound. The size of the entire case really helps give it that quality sound. When the lid is opened, it still sound fine, but not as good as it is closed.I paid around $20 for mine, and at that price I think it's fair. Don't pay much more for it though, you can get better players than this.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2020
CommentsContent: Sounds awful. And scratched some of my records. I wasn’t expecting a lot for price but I got even less than I expected.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this with low expectations, but they weren't low enough because the sound was unlistenable on these speakers. I tried to connect it to my bluetooth speaker and still the sound quality was terrible. It wins the portability contest. It's very portable. But it has no way to control the pitch or tone and the sound stinks. I returned it and bought an Audio Technica AT-LP60XBT turntable that has a bluetooth connect feature and the sound is GREAT. I am very happy with the purchase. If you already have a bluetooth speaker, this turntable has a good enough built in pre-amp to transmit a great sound. Spend the money and get the better stuff.

CommentsTitle: Great price and well built and sounding for what u spend
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 12, 2020
CommentsContent: Added a video.  Ice portable product. No Tom control. Nice listening to Vinyl again. I did order some inexpensive speakers that r  quality along with a subwoofer & equalizer. When I did the demonstration in the video u u can’t hear me for a few seconds. I got some great speakers woth a small sub woofer and an equalizer to take more control over the sound being produced outof this until.  The way this one sits tho: the sound fills my very large bedroom. And itIs decent sounding. But I am extremely picky in sound and record a lot of things and work with video production so that is why I want to add bigger speakers and a receiver.This will go with me frlm placeTo place when K get away for the weekend with my best friend (my English Bulldog Ethel Mae). And yes: she digs the new portable player too.This would make a great inexpensive gift. My daughter got one years back. It is fun to see her get into LP’s now.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 25, 2020
CommentsContent: I was so excited to give this Christmas gift to my spouse, who is a true music lover. I could barely wait for her to open it and her eyes lit up like a little kid.  She immediately grabbed it and set it up.  The sound was great-for a few minutes.  Then it started to skip.  And skip.  I had read the reviews and purchased an accessory to help with this problem but unfortunately it did not stop the skipping at all.  The hardest thing was watching the light go out of my wife's eyes as she turned this thing off and moved on.There are no words to express how disappointed I am in this product.  I will be returning it for a refund and I guess now that I have all of these albums, I will invest in a more expensive model; as I should have in the beginning. This was such a cute product. I was really hoping that the quality would be as stated.  So bummed.

CommentsTitle: New Records WILL skip with this unit
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2020
CommentsContent: After having this product for 3 months, I am officially done with it and trashing it to buy the Sony ps-lx310bt model. I will say this, if you're looking for something to play the stash of records you found in your fathers attic, this will play beautiful. However, that is where the good of this device will end. If you buy new records, maybe you'll get a song or two that plays properly, but the rest of your album will skip. Any new record is doing this for me. I am passed the return window so Amazon agreed to return, but were charging me a restock fee. On a $50 unit.. it's not worth it. I should have researched more into turntables before wasting my money & time with this unit. I suggest, if you want to listen to newer records, start shopping for new records, stay far far away from this cheap record player.

CommentsTitle: Not a fan of the sound quality. Constantly skips and changes volume.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2019
CommentsContent: I’ve only had this item for about an hour and a half and I’m not satisfied. I watched some other photo reviews and the sound seemed so much better. But now that it’s here in person, the sound quality isn’t all that great. Now it’s not TERRIBLE - but let’s just say my crappy iPhone speaker sounds better. The bass isn’t captured well. The item itself is a tad flimsy on the inside. Don’t push or pull anything too hard or it will probably break. As far as the look - it’s lovely. If this is something you’re buying for decoration, then it’s probably a good fit. The color is nice and the record player buckles up well. I don’t use headphones but there is also an AUX and headphone jack in case you want to connect it to other speakers or your headphones. But honestly, I bought this thing in hopes it could make it’s own decent sound. So I will be asking for a return as the quality of sound and music is not good. Also, the speed goes up and down during the songs. So it will play super fast and then super slow randomly. 🙄

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2019
CommentsContent: While this is no means for an audiophile, it is a great record player for majority of listeners. It has great portability so you can plug up at a cookout or your friend's house. The speakers don't have amazing quality but that's not why you'd buy this one; I use my audio technica and my stereo system for HQ sound. BUT it has a headphone jack so you can listen in great quality! This makes a great player for anyone who doesn't care about audiophile sound quality so this makes a really cool gift for like 90% of people. I've bought 3 so far; one for me and two for gifts to family members. The Bluetooth function is great as it allows it to be used to play music from your phone (Hard to carry 15 vinyls to a picnic). All in all, this makes a great record player for its price and makes a wonderful gift to anyone who maybe wants to play records but maybe doesn't want to shell out 90 plus bucks for a full blown stereo compatible player. My grandpa and mom loved these as gifts because they love the nostalgia of records but also don't know how to set up and hook up a stereo and speakers for a full player. I still keep mine for its portability as most full players are not portable by any means. Great product!

CommentsTitle: As expected: beginner quality, decent starter
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2020
CommentsContent: Just tested this out for my 14 yo first turntable for Xmas. Sound quality is as expected for a portable starter player. Reminds me of an old Walkman type radio reception. Music comes through just fine (we’ve all gotten use to top of the line tech and this just isn’t it. Again- as expected).Shipping was swift, no damage and item was very well packaged, protected needles, plastic wrapped.The turntable piece is a little bit questionable as far as quality (cheap plastic) yet with care the device will be great for a child’s first experience.

CommentsTitle: As easy to use as my childhood record player.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2021
CommentsContent: This little player is giving me a lot of listening pleasure. The sound wasn’t quite good enough, so i hooked up the edifier g2000 speakers to it. I also got a diamond needle, and a silicon slip mat. The quality of sound, and volume, are surprisingly good. I made a few trips to goodwill for records, since i had none at all. I bought a few brand new, but the sound just wasn’t as good as vintage records provided. Apparently, new records are recorded from digital music. I haven’t used the blutooth yet. There wasn’t any difficulty in setup. I just plugged it in, plugged in the speakers, and turned in on. I now listen to records all day long. Classical, jazz, big bands, british invasion, gospel, chorales, etc. Such fun!

CommentsTitle: Bluetooth is NOT for hearing records played on your BT speaker
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2020
CommentsContent: Don't buy this if you think you think you can connect your Bluetooth speaker to it to play your records and hear them on your Bluetooth speaker. This stupid thing has Bluetooth so you can stream your music to its crappy speakers.Why would I buy a record player with BT just so I can stream music from my device on super low quality speakers?Why would I lug around a record player just to use its super lame speakers? And not play records??!You can spend the same amount and buy an awesome JBL portable speaker. This product makes no sense. Yes, it plays records. At least that is true to form. ALSO: the case top when open has not latch to keep it open so it can fall shut right on top of your record as it plays. We will have to unscrew the lid to keep it from falling down.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 14, 2020
CommentsContent: My grandson recently discovered my extensive collection of old vinyl and was determined to listen to them.  When he realized many of them had belonged to my grandfather and pre-dated vinyl he became more determined to hear them.  Classical orchestras, 30’s/40’s old time country, Big Bands, plus my own 60’s/70’s collections.  His mother refused my offer of letting him have our old glass fronted stereo cabinet so this was the smaller solution that made them both happy.  The sound is not the greatest but he easily hooked it up to his own Bluetooth speakers and is thrilled with the sound.  I admit it makes me happy to know he appreciates “my music” as well as his great grandfather’s.  I think I’ve created a new vinyl freak and it’s fun to see his enthusiasm.  The price was right on this product and he enjoys using it daily.

CommentsTitle: Even low price tag doesn't make this turntable worth it.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2018
CommentsContent: I bought this turntable thinking it'd be a good starter for me (something to have while I saved up for a really good quality one). I might as well have saved my money and just waited longer to get a turntable.I'm fine with all the plastic since this was supposed to be a temporary starter one for me, but the low quality sound is ridiculous.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2021
CommentsContent: I purchased his items as a birthday gift.  The item stopped working within a couple months.  It was too late to return through Amazon but should have been covered under the manufactures warranty and Amazon provided me with the contact information.  I do love that Amazon is helpful!However, Customer Support for Victrola advised that I should try to "use a different power cord with the same specifications if I had one available, and see if the unit powers on".  If it did not work, they would "arrange to have a replacement power cord sent".However, since receiving that email on 12/4, they have not returned any emails.I have tried calling a couple times but do not get to a person.It is very frustrating.

CommentsTitle: Stylus Skips / Terrible Customer Support / Nice Tie Dye Finish
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2021
CommentsContent: Bought 4 months ago as birthday gift for daughter. Nice style and design.  Some of my old LP's played, other's didn't.  I figured the records were old and scratched.  Fast forward to December.  Daughter received a few new vinyl records for Xmas and two wouldn't play without skipping.  Again, these are BRAND NEW records.  I tried the same LP's on my vintage player and they played perfectly.  I assume the included stylus (needle) is too crude to play the records properly.  I've tried to contact Victrola via both email and telephone and have received no answer.Two stars is generous for this player and the company.  I'm giving it 0 stars for customer service, 0 for playability and 5 stars for the Tie Dye finish.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2019
CommentsContent: This is hand’s down the worst record player I have ever heard. It would turn on, have a long pause, and then begin playing. The records would constantly skip and albums would randomly stop playing altogether. Sound quality was subpar at best, for the times I could actually hear enough. The only thing I can positively state about this thing is that it is indeed portable. If portability is your main criteria here then you’re golden. If you’re looking for more than portability, I’d look elsewhere.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 27, 2017
CommentsContent: I know this isn't a brand "audiophiles" like, but as a millennial looking to play my parents old records and make my own discoveries, this is pretty dang awesome! It only took about 10 minutes to get it up and working, it's nice and loud, and for the records that were in good shape, it played them properly and clearly. Plus, it looks nice, it's not super heavy, and it satisfied an itch to be a hipster I never knew I had!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 8, 2020
CommentsContent: Remembering the album collection that My parents have and the record player from so many years ago that no longer works, left me craving the vintage sound from back in the day. This new school record player with Bluetooth is a perfect mash up of old school and new school.The sound is clear. The connection was easy. The only minor issue I had was the needle skipping in the beginning. I did a little research and just like my parents did back in the day (directly from customer support), a couple of quarters to weigh the needle down and no more skipping. I am very happy with my purchase!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 6, 2019
CommentsContent: Works, but it sound quality is horrendous. I’m not an audiophile snob either. I’d be satisfied with “passable”. This is unlistenable. There is no low end at all, even with decent external speakers. It’s all high end and extremely harsh to listen to. When using Bluetooth, the sound is passable with the external speakers. But do not buy this for playing records. It’s awful. If I could return mine I would, but it’s long past the return date.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2018
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   Review of: "Victrola Vintage 3-Speed Bluetooth Suitcase Turntable with Speakers, Black."This is a very reasonable priced portable plug-and-play system that allows you to play your LP's in 33/45/78 RPMs.  The case is sturdy and light and the arm and needle are very sensitive.  The sound quality is fantastic for a system this size and you have the option to line in using an AUX cord or use Bluetooth with the system to play music or sound.  I am very impressed by this system.  After having sold my multi-component Onkyo sound system and massive speakers years ago to include my turntable I can once again play my vinyl.  It is wonderful.  The sound and features of this small system rank high.  Five stars.

CommentsTitle: The bad reviews shouldn’t be ignored.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2021
CommentsContent: The sound that is produced is not in stereo. I thought I could connect external speakers but the outputs aren’t working. Bluetooth doesn’t allow you to connect to a Bluetooth speaker, but does allow you to play music through the record player, and sounds wonderfully mono. I was so excited to get this and I’m very disappointed.

CommentsTitle: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY-----Terrible sound!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2019
CommentsContent: This player has the absolute worse sound.  Everything played (new records) sounds like a cat fight. My granddaughter asked me to please get her something different so she could enjoy her new records.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 13, 2020
CommentsContent: For the price this is a Surprisingly good record player.I purchased it for my teen who is interested in playing old vinyl records.With Auto-off mode, the table stops spinning too soon before a record is over. This is more annoying when spinning 45 size records. With the auto-off feature disabled, records do reach the end. So that’s a workaround.The sound from the small speakers is also Surprisingly good. Taking the sound out of the earphone jack into a Portable, more robust speaker works well too.It’s a belt driven turntable without the ability to adjust the speed. But, it’s a great entry level turntable for a teen wanting to experience music the old fashioned way.Mine is enjoying playing the full albums and reading the liner notes and lyrics.... the way it should be.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2021
CommentsContent: I'll just say flat-out that I am pleasantly surprised at how good my unit sounds. For the price, I certainly expected worse. I have been listening to Miles Davis - Kind of Blue for the last couple hours, and my Klipsch's are making this thing sing. It really does sound quite good, and for what this cost, I have absolutely 0 complaints on that end of things. As far as the built-in speakers, I only heard them for a minute before hooking the player into a much larger separate system, but from what I did hear, the built-in speakers were adequate, thought certainly not outstanding. If you have a separate system of decent or higher quality to plug this into, I strongly recommend you do that if you mainly plan to listen to it at home.The only thing that caused me to dock a star is that the unit I received does have an immediately noticeable amount of wobble on the platter. This is not affecting the sound quality and it still appears to be operating within spec, but the leveling of the platter is still something that certainly could be done better. But again, for the price you're paying here, you really can't go expecting perfection. Overall, this is great first foray into vinyl, and I never thought I'd enjoy it as much as I am.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2020
CommentsContent: It's cute, it's very basic, and it plays LPs. So it does what it says it'll do. Four stars because the sound isn't great but honestly I didn't expect it to be. I think you could connect it to a stereo but tbh I don't listen to albums like in the old days, one after another after another. It's fun to pop an album on from the 70s or 60s and listen to it then flip it over and listen to the other side. One gets used to endless streams of music with all the digital stuff we have nowadays but there's something satisfying about playing an LP you used to play ages ago.Oh and the needle drops quite lightly on the album, not fast like one might expect on a cheaper turntable like this.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 6, 2020
CommentsContent: Pros: Great for beginners like meEasy to use and very portableA price practically anyone can affordGreat color choicesCons: cheap feeling plastics on the insideBuilt in speakers suckYou need to hookup speakers to get good soundThe Bluetooth is pretty much pointless because i cant use it with a Bluetooth speaker and the record wont spin in Bluetooth mode anywaysWith all that being said the cheap plastics can be expected at this price point so I’ll let that pass but I don’t get the point if having a Bluetooth mode if you cant play the music through a Bluetooth speaker plus the record only spins when its in phono mode so even if you could pair it to a speaker it would be pointless anyways, that being the main reason i only gave it 4 stars. But for the price this is an amazing record player. I bought a mini amplifier and i used some old bookshelf speakers that i had and I hooked them up to the record player and it sounds great and is the perfect little setup (as seen in the attached picture)

CommentsTitle: I'm no audiophile, but this thing is cool.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 23, 2021
CommentsContent: Wife bought this for me for Christmas along with a handful of new records to supplement an old stash inherited from my grandma.This turntable is super cool, clean looking, and a great conversation piece.  Naturally, you can spin vinyl and it sounds great....but you can also bluetooth in and push tunes from your phone, so it doubles as a really nice BT speaker.It's very user friendly and comes with great instructions (should you be new to vinyl) and a replacement needle.There are plenty of higher-end tables out there, but this one is compact, low-profile, and pushes very good sound.  I recommend it.

CommentsTitle: do not bother getting this. poor sound, does not come fully equipped-missing ac adaptor.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2021
CommentsContent: VEry, very poor sound. Not worth any money when it promises to be a good sound. Sounds like you are playing records that are 100 years old.  Came without AC Adapter which WE had to buy separately. Really-a product comes without all the parts(and over a month late) and the buyer is responsible to search and pay for the Adapter that should have bee part of the order!!! Terrible customer service.Terrible. Can't be used and not worth buying. Would have gotten a better, more expensive one but I believed what was written. Gift for daughter, but she does not want it because the sound is so so bad.  So sorry I bought it. Expected better from Amazon which we use all the time. Need to RETHINK that for sure!! DONT BELIEVE WHAT YOU READ!!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2020
CommentsContent: Turntable seemed very easy to set up.  Once an album was played, you immediately hear poor tinny sound quality for the internal speakers.  Doubting the internal, I connected external speakers to the RCA jacks.  Same tinny result.  So I decided to connect to Bluetooth with my iPhone.  That made a difference.  This leads me to believe they are using a cheap stylus and cartridge.  I have asked tech support if there is a higher quality stylus and cartridge that can be used on the player.  I have yet to hear back from them, it has been almost a week.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 9, 2017
CommentsContent: Our unit worked as expected out of the box. The turntable rotates completely flat, the needle arm picks up well with the lifter and drops very quietly onto the record.  At the end of the tracks it stops the turntable with the needle in the center of the record.  The sound is quite loud enough for a single room very similar to the original units that we played in the 60/70's.  Certainly not HiFi but considering the tiny speakers it's very good, more treble than base.  Plugging in the RCA or Headphone outputs to another speaker system gives better sound with more bass.  Note that the Bluetooth is only a receiver and so you'll need to plug in a BT Transmitter into the RCA or headphone jacks if you want to play records via BT to another BT speaker system.The black case looks nice and "retro" on top of our wooden stereo cabinet and we like the idea that we can shut the case and keep the dust out or just snap closed the latch and pick it up like a mini suitcase and take it with us to someplace else.  Great value for the money, a good "novelty" gift for someone who has a stash of old 33 records that they haven't listened to for 40 years!

CommentsTitle: Decent record player for those new to vinyl, may need to modify
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 27, 2020
CommentsContent: This isn't a bad record player, it has decent sound quality and does what it was made to do. It is a pretty good starter or budget player for listeners branching out or getting back into vinyl. That said it does have its own issues. Out of the box this record player would skip on older vinyls and there was a strange scratch noise when I played any of my collection. After a few minutes of scrutiny using an inherited scratched record (something I keep for diagnostic tests for any new player), I found that the skip was because the arm didn't lower enough to maintain contact with the vinyl. The fix was a rubber disc that I had left over from a broken record player. The rubber disc raised the record high enough to maintain needle contact even on slightly warped records. The second issue of the scratching noise turned out to be caused by a plastic guard at the base of the arm. This small piece of plastic would rub at the edge of the vinyls while spinning producing the scratch noise. That fix was simply using a fine fingernail emery board (800/10000 grit) to remove just enough material to put a stop to the noise but not impede the function of the plastic guard. After those simple fixes I had no problems with the record player.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 5, 2019
CommentsContent: I purchased this record player, and all it did was skip. I tried several different records and had the same results. I cleaned the records, made sure the needle was good etc. I finally called the technical support number where I was told that any records purchased after the year 2000 will not work properly on this player (there is nothing about this mentioned on the product details page). Support said I could put a penny or nickle on the arm base to see if that helps. I did not spend $50 to rig it to work. I expect a working product or to have been told up front what works and what doesn't so I wouldn't have to waste my time to purchase. Please do not waste time or money on this!

CommentsTitle: The most gorgeous garbage you can buy
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 31, 2020
CommentsContent: The one-star was for how beautiful the exterior was.  Had really high hopes for it.  The turn table itself was total crap.  Skips more than a high school senior.  We tried two classic heirloom discs and one brand new press (2019).  The skipping was all over the place.  We also found the RCA output sound was flatter than drywall.  If you want your eyes to bleed with unabashed rage, this is the product for you.  :(

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2021
CommentsContent: Will be returning this player. It was enticing at first with its cute color and design but the proof is in the pudding and this player is not worth the money. Wobble is pretty severe and even brand new records sound distorted in places just making for a very poor listening experience.  On a side note, I suppose foolishness on my part but I thought that the bluetooth feature would allow me to play records through my nice marshall speaker. Nope! You can however a connect your phone to the crappy speakers of the record player, so if you want your music to sound like sharing one ear bud with three people than its a great feature.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2020
CommentsContent: I was really looking forward to receiving this turntable as a present to myself for Christmas. It is very small, cheap looking, and not worth the money I spent on it. The sound is not clear, it doesn't look big enough for a 33 LP record which barely fits sticking out over the edge. Everything about it looks false and low quality. It's an insult to consumers. I am very disappointed, and of course it is made in China.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2019
CommentsContent: I’m just really disappointed in this turntable. I don’t know very much about sound quality and which speakers are the best to purchase , but I assumed that a well known brand like Victrola would make a decent product. The case is beautiful and everything inside is functional and easy to use, which I love, but it’s hard for me to get excited to play or buy a new record when I know that the record player won’t deliver a decent quality of sound to match a beautiful record. I got this as a present for my dad on his birthday so that he could listen to some of his old records, but I wish I had chosen a different brand.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2019
CommentsContent: I’ve had it for all of 30 minutes and love it so far. The box came in good condition, and it has just enough volume to fill a small/medium room (which is exactly what I wanted: my parents’ record player can be heard throughout the house, but deafens the room it’s in).Clear instructions: plug it in, turn on via volume control, remove plastic cap over needle, lower arm over record, & listen. :)There is a good 1.5/2cm gap between record & back of the player, so no issues there (from what I’ve observed on this player, unless using a non-standard record, record length should be a non-issue).If anything changes over time, I’ll modify this review.

CommentsTitle: Just like the one when I was a kid (not quality wise)
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2019
CommentsContent: Despite all the reviews I LOVED the vintage map pattern of this and didn't have a record player. I figured for the price and the brand that it would be similar to the fischerprice one I had when I was a kid...soundwise yes, quality wise no.Pros: small, portable, lightweight, nostalgic, LOOKS ABSOLUTELY ADORABLE (got the matching vinyl holder), case is durable.Cons: tiny delicate parts, needle attached was messed up but the extra needle works fine, speakers are subpar but slightly better than I expected, seems cheaply constructed on the inside.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2019
CommentsContent: This thing sucks, The sound is really bad and comes out sounding thin or like a tin can speaker if that makes sense. Even when I plugged it into my home speakers the signal still came out thin.If you want a turntable for your home but don't need a crazy expensive one I really suggest going the route after returning this product and went for the Audio Technica AT-LP60BK turntable. It's a bit more in price but you will be much happier.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 25, 2019
CommentsContent: Turn table is wobbly and speaker quality is horrible. On the way to be returned.The look of it is cool and small to carry anywhere but it should play a record without being so wobbly. Tried to go old school with a penny on top to keep it steady but didn’t work.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2020
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   Really love this. I been looking for one just to play the few albums I have and this is great. All parts arrived and the next day.

CommentsTitle: NEGATIVE: A year later, I really don't like it - here's why.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2020
CommentsContent: Bad quality speakers, records get scratched, knobs break easily, and a year later mine won't turn on anymore. The speakers sound like a tin can, so you're not getting the crackle of the vinyl desired. The needle scratched some brand new records I bought because the turntable is not flat. The plastic knobs like the tonearm lifter snapped off. 18 months after buying this product and it won't even turn on anymore.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2021
CommentsContent: I knew when I purchased this record player the sound wasn't going to be the best (which I was right), and I was okay with that since this was for my daughter and we could hook up better speakers to it.  However, the turntable squeaked every time we played a record and it wouldn't finish playing a 45 rpm record.  It would stop right before the song ended.I would spend more money on something with better quality or find a nice used record player at a thrift store like we did.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2021
CommentsContent: Very nice record player.It very easy to use, not to much hassle its as easy as plug in and start playing records.I would like to point out that the seller has awesome customer service. Whe I got my unit I sent some questions their way via email since my Bluetooth functionality as well as de aux was not working, I could not use Bluetooth or even headphones with it. But the records would play perfect with the built in speakers. In less then a day they wrote back and apologized for the inconvenience, and they were  nice enough to send a replacement unit. Its the one I'm using now and it's wonderful. If what you are looking for is sound quality I would recommend pluggin in a speaker since it's super easy to do, you just need a RCA cable with a 3.5 mm to put into your speaker and the magic starts. I would definetly recomend.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 2, 2019
CommentsContent: Didn’t work. Plugged it in and it won’t turn on. Will return and try again. Not to mention the actual product is a different shade of blue than is in the picture. The actual record player is a deeper blue and has more green in it.Update: returned and got the black one and I love it. Mainly got it to replace a Crosley that was giving me problems and I wanted something that had Bluetooth so I could use it a speaker too

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2021
CommentsContent: This is a fantastic product. I had little to no knowledge on how these work, and it was pretty easy to figure out. The manual is thorough, there’s an extra pin for playing once one wears out. The sound quality was so much better than I expected, even the Bluetooth was wonderful. There’s also a plug for an Aux cord and for headphones. The speakers are located below the handle on the outside, and when using the Bluetooth, it sounds best when the cover is closed (the acoustics are fuller). I was super pleased with this purchase. Will probably buy another in the future for family/friends.

CommentsTitle: Trendy and portable but sounds like complete garbage.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 11, 2020
CommentsContent: 7/28/20**I have changed my review after using it a few weeks.  It looks very cool, and if you are looking for something trendy this is a good bargain.  However, if you are a beginner looking to get serious about vinyl, this unit is a huge disappointment.  The sound is garbage, even when run through quality speakers or a sound system.I wasn't expecting it to sound great on its own, but I was not expecting it to sound as bad as it did when I ran it though several different setups.If you want a good quality sound of your vinyl, stay away from this unit and spend more money on a better turntable!!** I will most likely keep it for its portability though, moving it around the house or garage.  That's the only good thing about it.

CommentsTitle: ADORABLE, not pefect... but really really fun and cute
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 2, 2017
CommentsContent: Prepare to adore it, but understand it won't be perfection. It is cuter than cute. The vinyl cover has some  rough edges and isn't as elegantly constructed as an actual vintage item, but it's so wonderfully vintage-looking and it's blue tooth is surprisingly practical too. Don't expect too much from the speakers, they do sound small and tinny (I plan to use it most usually with external speakers as soon as I can figure out how to get them to work). There is some awkwardness with putting the needle arm back into non use position, but still and again, the cuteness wins me over. Bluetooth connection was easy to find but is a bit shaky right now. I am happy to have a way to listen to my old records again.

CommentsTitle: Worth buying if you’re not a serious record collector!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2020
CommentsContent: Love this little thing!I’ll be honest.. my purchase was 50% for aesthetics and 50% wanting to use the vinyls that we’re collecting dust in my office. This did the trick! I’ve been playing music non stop. Occasionally a song will skip a little but I’m thinking it’s more to do with dust on the vinyls than this record player.If you’re not super serious about records and music, this little thing will do the job! If you’re a collector or value the sound quality, maybe spend the extra money on a higher quality one.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2019
CommentsContent: The fact that it’s a suitcase but has to be plugged in is contradicting but I ended up removing the top half anyway. The sound quality is garbage, the headphone jack is fiddly and the aux out not only has interference but the audio still plays out the terrible speakers while external speakers are plugged in anyway. I thought the quality would be better through external speakers but it’s just as terrible. The table skips on occasion and could ruin records. This is not even worth buying if you only have a couple records, i highly recommend getting something else.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this unit thinking it would be cool to take my vinyl collection with me sometimes. I was hoping to share the listening experience of old music, as I have records from the 1920's. When I got the item, I unpackaged it right away. It was exactly what was pictured. It looked great.Excited to try it out, I play one of my vintage Christmas records on it. This was a regular 33 vinyl record. So, nothing special, and did not require the special stylus for the 78 records. OH BOY, I thought while shaking my head in disappointment. The sound was HORRIBLE.......absolutely HORRIBLE. I have 5$ Bluetooth speakers that sounds better than this.The description for this product states "Additional features include a custom tuned Pre-Amp for improved audio clarity and bass performance". The was not the case. The custom tuned pre-Amp has the high tones up way too far. So much that the speakers peak. There is absolutely no bass tones. The mids are muffled.I figured I would try to connect it to a Bluetooth speaker, thinking the quality would be better. NOPE.....it was the same.....absolute garbage..... Trust me, my Bluetooth speaker is high quality. I took it a step further and plugged in some high quality in ear headphones that I use as a musician. They have 5 drivers in each ear. So the sound should be amazing.......NOPE.....again, complete GARBAGE.Secondly, I would like to add, that the stylus on this player can be harsh on your records. looking at an independent review, they advise not to use this unit for everyday use, as it will wear out the grooves in your records. What good is a record player if you cannot use it to play your records as much as you want?On the tech side of things, most records are made or vinyl. A 33-vinyl record has a groove that is 0.7 mils wide. A 78 has a groove that is 0.3 mils wide. If you use the wider stylus in an old 78 record you will ruin it. The stylus on this product is metal......that's right, metal. What happens when you place metal on plastic? Kiss the record good bye. Most stylus back in the day were made of diamonds or sapphires. They would fit in the groove exactly and produce a high-quality sound. Over time a record will break down, that's normal. But using the wrong stylus, you will accelerate the breakdown. Oh, and you cannot change out or upgrade the stylus. The cartage and stylus is sold as one unit and only fits this unit. No other aftermarket parts will fit.Stop!!!!!, and do yourself a favor, look for other record players with better quality. As for me, I'm not going to ruin my collection because of a low-quality product. GARBAGE......

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 1, 2019
CommentsContent: Maybe something is wrong with mine, but the sound was awful. Worth noting that mine had no Victorola branding on it, Instead it was Innovative Technology so I’m not sure if that’s the cause of the awful quality.I’m not an audiophile. I’ve had several of those portable Crosley players and been perfectly fine with the quality. This really needs a pitch adjustment knob more than it needs bluetooth. It’s too bad because it’s cute and affordable but not worth it in the slightest even at $40.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 20, 2019
CommentsContent: There is no method of balancing the tone arm. This POS bounces like a cheap stripper in a North Florida bikini bar. The best you can do is tape two nickles to the tone arm and that slows down the rotation. IT has refused to respond so I have a record player with a couple of nickles.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2020
CommentsContent: Worst purchase I've made. I bought this in March for my daughter, but because of the pandemic it was in storage until she moved out in the fall. When she finally opened it, it did not work at all. Since I was past the return deadline, I tried working directly with the manufacturer. They sent me a new cord which turned on the power, but only produced a high-pitch whining sound. VERY disappointed that they would not follow up. We're out the full cost with no option i know of except throwing it in the trash. Such a disappointment!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 12, 2019
CommentsContent: I love this victrola record player. I'm so happy to be able to play my record collection now. It's a beautiful player and it works great. The sound is OK, but you can add speakers if you want to. Bluetooth speakers will work if they have an Auxilary input. The player does not send Bluetooth signals but will receive (like from your phone). Extra Note :the Autostop works perfect with albums (big records) but stops a little too soon with some 45s (small records). But there is an off/on switch for this, so put it off while playing 45s. It seems to be well made and I'm very happy with it. It comes with an extra needle and if you register it on Victrola.com/registration with the model number and serial number, they will even send you another replacement needle as a gift. (at least they are doing that at the moment lol) it's always good to have backups.

CommentsTitle: Love the new portable record player!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2021
CommentsContent: Got this for my husband for Christmas. He absolutely loves it. I was able to play my Led Zeppelin vinyl albums I haven’t heard in over 35 years. Now in the evenings we have something to talk about because he plays his new portable turntable and all the old classics from the 60s 70s and 80s that we loved. Thank you for creating this wonderful piece of nostalgia for us.

CommentsTitle: You get what you pay for.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2018
CommentsContent: The sound of this awful machine is an insult to recorded sound.  It's pretty difficult for a scratchy, old 78 from 100 years ago to sound worse than it does on an actual 100 year old acoustic Victrola, but this item fits the bill.Do not confuse this with the excellent product now being produced by the successor to the Victor Company, who is now producing American-made phonographs in Camden, NJ under the VICTROLA label.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 15, 2018
CommentsContent: If I had written this review when I first received this turntable, the review would have been glowing.It was a Warehouse bargain but the only noted damage was to the box.I've been using this for a little over a month, a few hours a week when I work from my home office, and it has already stopped working. It will no longer turn on.I'm so disappointed. This was a birthday present to myself so that I could enjoy the vinyl records I've been collecting for years without having to fire up our big stereo system. There should have been way more than a month of service for the price I paid. It's worth spending a little extra to get a nicer, more recognized brand.It's so unfortunate that I'm out of the return window and stuck with just a little red suitcase.

CommentsTitle: Cute and great as a Bluetooth speaker, but not a good record player
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 21, 2020
CommentsContent: I love the design and the functionality of this as a speaker, but as a record player, it is terrible. Most of my records don't play without skipping, and it is especially true with records that are newer releases or have any coloring to the vinyl. But even older vinyl has issues, too. I do not own a single record that plays without skipping on this machine.  But all is not lost - it does work really well as a speaker, and it is usually very easy to connect to devices via Bluetooth. But I didn't buy this to use as a speaker - I bought it as a record player, and it absolutely FAILS at that!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 24, 2017
CommentsContent: The record player I used previously has issues playing some of my heavier weighted records, but this player handles the heavy records very easily! In addition to that, I hadn't noticed (when I purchased the player) the little switch or lever that moves the tone arm over the record and slowly drops it into place! That was a nice surprise since I always have issues dropping the needle accidentally. The color of the suitcase is just as advertised. The speakers are good quality, but can have some unpleasant fuzz when the sound is turned too loud or a particularly intense part of the record is playing. The music coming out of the speakers is soft and creates a nice ambiance in my room. I would definitely purchase this player again and recommend it to those looking to purchase one. Regardless if you're a a novice or experienced record listener, this player will satisfy! It comes with a replacement needle, power cord, and 45 adapter.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2021
CommentsContent: This is really, really not a quality record player.  I understand why people are drawn to it.  The case is really nice-looking in a vintage way, and it's cool to think that you're tapping into the long history of Victrola.  The sound is OK for what it is, when it works.Unfortunately, that name is all this player has to do with Victrola.  The player uses a needle and turntable assembly that is very, very cheap and low quality and is used in almost *all* portable suitcase players.  (There are videos out about this if you look around.)  Mine worked fine for about two months, and then decided to stop spinning records at the right speeds.  If you have any experience with record players you can tell how flimsy it is when you use it.  Also, this doesn't have Bluetooth connectivity in the sense that you can use a Bluetooth speaker with the player - it means that you can use the speakers on the player with one of your other devices like a phone or a laptop.If you want something portable, there are much more reputable companies out there making much better players in the low $100s.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2020
CommentsContent: This is a great little record player.Plays my records without any problems or scratches.Build quality is better than I expected.Quick Bluetooth connection.Front speakers arent TOO bad. They're loud but....Although the bluetooth connection is almost immediate. It does lack low end (bass) when streaming music vs a record.Not a deal breaker though.*The ONLY CON I have found is when speakers are connected to the back ports , the front speakers are still active and audible.*Came with a replacement needle and 45 adapter when needed.I highly recommend this record player for anyone of all ages. And will be purchasing another in the near future for the family room .

CommentsTitle: Turned it on and the turntable didn’t spin at all, it doesn’t work
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 16, 2019
CommentsContent: I ordered this product and it was sent back by USPS because the box was so damaged. Amazon gave me a quick and full refund. So I ordered the product a second time because I like the way it looks and really wanted to play my records. When the product arrived today, the second time, it was not in a protective box, just the actual product box with a bunch of packaging tape on it which was clearly covering up a huge hole in the box. When I opened the box the product looked fine, it actually looked cool. I read the directions and plugged it in, and turned it on...the “on” light came on but when i went to put the tone arm on the record the turn table wouldn’t spin at all. There was nothing plugged into the aux in/out so that wasn’t the problem and the belt was on fine. I assume it is a motor issue. Anyhow Im sending it back now.

CommentsTitle: Really good for people just starting out
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 31, 2020
CommentsContent: I've always wanted one of these small record players, so after seeing the very reasonable price on this one I decided to try it out. The sound is amazing for the size of the speakers, and the slight crackle just adds another layer of vintage to whatever you're listening to. It's very easy to use, and the color is stunning. Overall, it's a fantastic little record player and I could recommend it to anyone who's never owned a record player and doesn't really know how to operate one. And it's super easy to find vintage records at antique shops for cheap, which just makes the whole deal even better.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 11, 2019
CommentsContent: I own a DuMont console record player... It stopped working awhile ago. Needs to be looked at and see what’s wrong with it..Therefore, just wanted something inexpensive and decent to be able to listen to my records in the meantime...Looked at many brands and saved countless on my Amazon wishlist...There is actually another Victrola player I want and probably will get...But let me tell you this little suitcase player works phenomenally well for the price point. I ordered the brown color only because it was cheaper:...For what it is the sound is actually pretty good. I mostly like to listen on record players jazz singers and jazz music...And this little guy resonates the music really good.. I was thinking of attaching my vintage speakers to it. But may not need too...I have it located in a small bedroom and fills the  room just fine...I read the reviews and many were mixed. Figure, let me take a chance. For the price, you can’t go wrong... My player arrived in perfect condition and packed nicely and everything works like it should...Greatly satisfied with the product.

CommentsTitle: Nice beginners/portable/budget option that doesn’t sound like crap
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 31, 2020
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   This is my first record player and I couldn’t be happier. The speakers have nice sound for the size and price of the unit. The unit feels fairly sturdy as well and I never noticed in tininess and am someone who often finds themselves annoyed by audio equipment in this price range. Obviously if you have some good speakers you’ll want to use those over the built in speakers but if you want something portable to use around the house or just to see if records are for you this is a good place to start and has a headphone out for pc speakers as well as the red and whites for traditional speakers.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 30, 2020
CommentsContent:
