Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   I really liked this, I was a bit skeptical because after researching, a lot of audiophiles hate these, but as a beginner and a broke teenager, it's amazing. I included a video of it. though, the speaker are really bad, it's not bad for how much it's worth

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2019
CommentsContent: I bought this for my daughter and a new record it skips and doesn’t play clear at all you can barely make out what the record is playing. Played the record on our other record player and it plays fine so I know it’s not the record.

CommentsTitle: not as good as I was expecting
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2019
CommentsContent: The sound quality isn't as good as I was expecting. It kind of crackles and sounds like the sounds coming out of a laptop. When playing records that are recordings it sounds better but live records, forget about it. I wanted to hook up my own speakers to it, but that seemed to be more of an issue than it was worth. I couldn't find speakers that had the right hook ups for the connections this player has. I like it because it's basic and does what it needs to and it is good for a budget buy, but I definitely wouldn't buy this one again.

CommentsTitle: Great price and easy to use!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 5, 2020
CommentsContent: This is my 1st record player. After reading the reviews and how popular this brand is I bought it. Plus, all the color options are great. I bought this brown one because i liked how it looked like leather. The brass pieces also give it an authentic suitcase look. It was easy to open and use. I just plugged in the cord and done. The ONLY downside would be that it does not have a clear lid to cover it when playing the record. So I am careful to put the player in a place where it won't get bumped or messed with. Great product, price and I would buy more for other rooms. Perfect for a house warming gift.

CommentsTitle: Didn’t hold up at all with minimal usage. Defective.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2021
CommentsContent: Stopped working after 84 days. It just won’t power on, no power light.Amazon won’t replace it.Good luck reaching anyone with the manufacturer. Now I see the have a limited 90 day warranty. I think we are screwed. It’s too bad. I am waiting for a response.This is not something I should of bought online. I should of gone to a local store. This teaches me a big lesson. I’ll be extremely careful about buying electronics or tech items online. Not worth the small savings if you get a lemon like we did.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 21, 2020
CommentsContent: Our kids in their 20's & 30's bought this for my husband for Fathers Day. My daughter had asked my oppinion, & I was like, oaawwwhh, the speakers will probably be tinny, low quality, just a trendy gift probably not worth it! My husband will think its a waste of money, He's very practical...our adult kids bought it anyway!All that I thought was completely wrong! It's adorable, like the portable size we had in the 60's & 70's. We love it! Brings back the days of sitting near a turntable listening to records over & over, changing them out , listening to faves etc. It's the whole experience. The speakers were sharp & incredibly good, unlike the old portables and the volume filled the room! We played my husband's ABBA albums first & It took only minutes for the dance moves to begin! Great time and we'll be going through some of those old ABBA, BEATLES< SHA-NA-NA, Joni Mitchel, James Taylor and more. Albums we haven't touched to play in over 40 years, oh goodness, that makes me sound so old and we're not! A DELIGHTFUL ITEM ALL AROUND & an experiencial trip into the past!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 6, 2017
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   Exactly what I was looking for!! Perfect size...light weight, travels well, speakers great for intimate party...Bluetooth feature is a nice plus. Love itttt! Comes with an extra needle, yay!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this as a gift for my daughter for Christmas, but did not take out and put in her bedroom at her home until later. No power cord was with the turntable...so I cannot tell you anything besides it looks pretty. When my daughter called Amazon, they said it did not come with a cord - I highly doubt that is the case. So I give it a 1 star because I have no clue if it works until I buy the power cord and some other cords we were told it needs.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 19, 2020
CommentsContent: Power cord plugged in the first time and I used the Bluetooth. Absolutely terrible sound. I could make a better sounding speaker...Second time I plugged it in I heard a bunch of feedback then the power went back out. Wouldn't stay on for more than a few seconds after that.Rickety toy. Not a record player.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 5, 2019
CommentsContent: I really like this record player and I wanted to work as long as possible. I'm disappointed though that after only about a year having it, the power cord overheats and it shuts down. I'm not going to have to buy a power cord and makes hopefully it will still work. Also, it would be super convenient if there was a compartment at the back to put the power cord in when it's being stored or transported.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 18, 2020
CommentsContent: So upset just got this today in the mail and it doesn’t work please don’t buy this !!! Waste of money

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2021
CommentsContent: Absolutely sounded horrendous.  Put a few records on, sound was flat, no bass.  Played through the system speakers, then played through Edifier speakers which usually sound incredible.  Not with this, flat sound, horrible.  Changed records, changed needle, put on new record, same.  Conclusion, it sucks.  I really wanted it to work.  Based on all the reviews, I'm guessing they made some manufacturing changes recently.  Lots of bad reviews, but all recent, so I'm guessing it changed and now sucks.

CommentsTitle: Did not play newer pressed vinyl without skipping.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2020
CommentsContent: I’m so bummed about this! A family member recommended this record player to me and I’m disappointed by it! It plays old vinyl just fine, but it does not play newly pressed vinyl without skipping. I even returned a vinyl record thinking that was the cause of it, but it still skipped on the replaced one! I saw someone mention in a review that they added some pennies onto the tone arm, which helps the record not skip, but then the record plays slower so you’re not getting the true sound...I was able to easily return it, but again, was sad I had to.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2021
CommentsContent: I was excited to get one of these because the reviews were pretty good. I love the color, and it’s very cute. I made sure to follow all instructions before turning on. I made sure to put it on a flat surface and everything. I don’t know if it’s just mines or if this is how all record players sound, but the music sounds like it’s vibrating too much. And choppy. I try putting it on a lower volume but it’s the same problem. My sister has a different brand record player that looks similar and hers does not have this issue. It’s almost like the speaker can’t handle the loudness of it and it sounds extremely muffled and choppy. Does anyone know if this is how it’s suppose to sound?

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 17, 2019
CommentsContent: I wanted this to work so bad! I got it so I could listen to records with my 5yo. Set it up right away - I was scared for the record player because it came shipped in the actual box - Just some styrofoam on either side of the player. But it looked great and I love the aqua color! Put the record on and it sounded crappy, but it’s probably pretty old. So I tried Bluetooth music. Sound was so scratchy! The speakers are crap. I also tried a podcast, just to be sure. Same. Totally returning it and I will look for something with better sound quality. Super bummed.

CommentsTitle: Clever design, useful for more than records
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 10, 2019
CommentsContent: Such a clever design and made me remember the record players of my youth ( oh yes there were boom boxes and more, then too: I’m not THAT old!).. And it was our teenage son who was the one who was requesting this! Spoiled by modern electronics, I thought the sound left a lot to be desired and our son says it’s better listening to recordings while wearing earphones/ear buds.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2019
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   Arrived the day it was supposed to, and I wrapped it up as a gift for my father for Christmas. I was SO excited! Excited is probably an understatement. He opened it and absolutely loved it, and grabbed a record to play. I immediately noticed the deck was not properly glued down. I was already disappointed in the purchase. Then the little hook where the neck rests disintegrated in my hand at barely a touch. I can’t take it away from him now since he loves it so much... but I will never purchase EVER again. I was going to buy one for myself, but after seeing the quality, I won’t be making that mistake. The only pro is that I got it to play.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 26, 2020
CommentsContent: I hate writing negative reviews on anything.  Truly.  But I don't want anyone to make the same mistake that I made.  I bought two of these.  One for me and one for my mother-in-law.Hers came first.  I set it up for her.  She loved it.Then she came to me and said all of her records are skipping so she's going to have to only buy new records.  I didn't think much of it as she has a very old collection that she hasn't looked at in 20 years.I got mine.  I played (or tried to play) a few brand new (never before played records) and most of them skipped.  i brought them upstairs to my really nice/expensive record player.  They worked perfectly.The problem seems to be in the player.  I would not look at this one.  Per haps I did something wrong, but I can't imagine what I could have done.Sorry that this didn't work out.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 30, 2019
CommentsContent: I was initially quite pleased with the price and performance of this machine.  However, after just a few periods of occasional use, the lift lever / arm damping mechanism has jammed, making the machine inoperable.  It has not been mistreated in any way.  Very disappointed that the machine broke so easily.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 24, 2020
CommentsContent: This was a gift for someone special, and it definitely was well-received!  I loved the fact that there is a large variety of colors and prints to choose from, and this British print was perfect.  It plays vinyl very well, good sound quality, and we like the fact that we can use the Bluetooth feature to play tunes from our phones.  Excellent product!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 17, 2019
CommentsContent: Started using this about three days now, it work just fine in the first two days. The sound quality isn’t great but I can bare with it. But sometime the arm will not move but it will work 10secs later. The three day suddenly there is those noises coming out from the speaker. And then some how I think I smelled smoke. I’m not sure. I unplugged the power immediately. When I plug in again the next day. The speaker stop working! Very disappointed! I was so happy to get this speaker when I ordered it.

CommentsTitle: Nice Broken Product With No Instructions
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2021
CommentsContent: It arrived broken with the center portion of the record player dropping. This caused the records to rub against the open top part of the case and play too slowly. It did not have instructions.  I was able to open and repair the support lip that held the center of the record player up and it now plays beautifully.  The bluetooth connects to your phone which is really handy. I like the basic product but selling it as used and "good condition" was a small stretch.  Regardless, I do enjoy it.

CommentsTitle: Bad out of box, poor quality control and poor assembly.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2021
CommentsContent: Birthday gift for my son, did not power up out of the box.  I verified 5v DC coming from wall plug adapter.  Pulled inside panel, and the printed circuit board that has the power switch, bluetooth, headphone jack etc, doesn't even have the connector plugged in to provide power Whoever assembled at fault I would suggest.  The power cable was wrapped around another cord an laying close to where it should have been plugged in.Very disappointing.  POOR quality control.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 31, 2018
CommentsContent: Had it for 9 months and love it. I don’t listen to may records, but it works well when I do Use it for that. I’ve found myself using it for the Bluetooth speaker a lot. I take It to family get togethers for us to play music on. My whole family has asked where I got It and are really impressed when I tell Them how inexpensive it was.I’m not a musician, so I’m sure people have stuff to say about speaker quality, but to me, it seems really good.I especially love how portable it is and how it looks like a decoration when I’m not using it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 30, 2020
CommentsContent: It looks BEAUTIFUL. Very easy to use. Sound quality is not at all what I thought it would be. I’ve bought Victrolas in the past and was therefore expecting it to sound clear, rich, and full. When I used it it sounded very tinny, muddled, and gravelly...as if someone threw sand into the speaker. Hopefully you have a better experience than I. I thought I would be able to connect it to an external speaker (my Alexa) via Bluetooth so I could hear the vinyl quality but through different speakers...nope. The record player itself acts as an external speaker (though I recommend against it given the sound quality) and you cannot connect to BT and play your record at the same time.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 7, 2020
CommentsContent: This is a good buy for under $40 if you aren’t overly concerned with audio quality.  However, I think most of us who buy this expecting it to be able to connect to Bluetooth speakers are disappointed.  The speakers are really poor.  The Bluetooth functions do not allow you to play the phonograph over Bluetooth speakers as I believe most would expect.  Rather, the phonograph acts as a Bluetooth speaker...and a poor one.

CommentsTitle: This product looks really nice, but that's about it
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2018
CommentsContent: This product looks really nice, but that's about it. As previously mentioned, the arm has no counterweight, so it will put too much pressure on the needle and scratch up your records. The turntable is made of thin plastic and extremely flimsy, my thicker 33s were extremely wobbly on it, which could lead to damaging your records. The sound was pretty bad, I'm not sure of the speaker quality was the problem or the cheap setup was the culprit for it, but the sound was fuzzy. The bluetooth does not allow you to play vinyl on other speakers, it allows you to use the record player speakers to play music from other devices, such as your phone, this is disappointing.This thing is a nice decoration, but the low quality will end up ruining your records.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 17, 2019
CommentsContent: This should be purchased for children only. It does not have quality sound. The speakers are very tinmy, and there’s only one port for an additional speaker.  We knew this before purchase, but to reiterate, it is Bluetooth only in the sense that the Tenny speakers will broadcast whatever you have playing on your phone or other device, not the reverse. It’s a cheap little thing,  I guess you get what you pay for.  It turns records and functions even though Amazon did not pack it within another box. The original packaging was beat all to hell, but the thing works anyway.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2020
CommentsContent: Do not waste your money. This is crap if your an audiophile and even worse for a beginner. The lid is prone to drop on the album (a simple locking hinge would have been a cheap fix) the needle is so bad that it’s skipped constantly on the three new albums I played. The experience overall was disappointing.I would not recommend at all.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 15, 2019
CommentsContent: First off, my 13 year-old loves this.  It's her first experience with records and she doesn't seem to notice or care about the awful, tinny, distorted, low-fi sound.  I did plug it into an external powered computer speaker which helps some.  So I guess this is OK as a starter turntable for a kid, but if you care even remotely (and I mean even the slightest) about sound quality, skip this model.  It sounds about as good as a 1970's AM transistor radio.  It does look cute though.

CommentsTitle: DON’T BUY THIS!!! This turntable was broken when I bought it. It’s terrible.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 13, 2020
CommentsContent: As soon as I got this turntable, it wasn’t working. I tried a bunch of different records (old, new, different sizes, etc.) and no matter what, it was skipping constantly. There is no way to balance the arm on the player, so I tried doing it myself with coins and small weights. Still skipping. I tried changing the needle with the replacement they sent. Still skipping. I contacted customer support for Victrola and their advice to me was to attempt to balance the arms myself (as I had already tried). Their advice is to tamper with their product in order for it to work. They sold a product that literally will not do the bare minimum (play music) without tampering with it using fishing weights I had to buy separately. They also told me it’s not compatible with 150/180 gram records. I could not find that information anywhere in the product description before buying it. This is false advertising. I’m waiting to hear back again from customer service about this. Hopefully they will attempt to refund or replace the product but I’m not sure they will considering they’re already sneaky enough to sell a brand new product that is useless.

CommentsTitle: Cute for a paper weight or for introducing maybe a young teen to vinyl
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 16, 2020
CommentsContent: Its super cute looking and I think it’d be good for a child but it skips a ton and slows down randomly and the whole thing is poorly constructed. I knew better because of the price but I don’t listen to vinyl a ton so I thought it would be fine. Not worth it, spend the money on a decent set up or just forget vinyl and stream YouTube cuz the sound quality is so bad. Vinyl isn’t cheap so spend the money to get something decent!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2021
CommentsContent: I wasn't expecting a premium piece of equipment, but due to the brand I thought I would at least be happy. It skipped all over the place (I played the records on tower turntables and they were fine), it's very cheap, the sound was really really bad, and I thought the Bluetooth would allow to send the sound to another speaker, not only receive. Maybe that was my fault for not knowing. But the quality was terrible. I would say get it for a kid only.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 30, 2019
CommentsContent: arrived fast and was in great condition! this was my first record player and the original needle it came with made the records skip, luckily they provide a backup with it and that needle works just fine!. As for the speakers there are alot of mixed reviews, for a portable speaker they are pretty good, about as good as a mid grade phone or a 15$ Bluetooth speaker from Walmart. if you are an audiophile looking for really good quality sound you need to have some of your own separate speakers to hook this up to. It has stereo plug ins on the back and I have it hooked up to an amp and it sounds great! if you don't care too much about sound quality and just want a cheap small record player I would definitely recommend this! The records wobble a little which I have heard is normal and doesn't affect the sound. for the average person this player is perfect but if you are looking for something high end that will be stationary in your room then you will need to spend way more than 40$. personally I love it and use it all the time, the colors are very pretty too! Perfect for a first time record player and would make a fantastic gift for anyone who enjoys listening to records!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 27, 2019
CommentsContent: Very nice for the price. I didn’t think I would like the compactness of this product but actually do. It’s so easy to pull out and entertain and put back on the shelf out of the way. Nice sound and hooks to my phone with ease. Turntable is smooth with no vibration. I’d buy again.

CommentsTitle: Not sure what happened, but it happened.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 24, 2019
CommentsContent: At first, I was a little disappointed with the overall sound quality the product produced. It's akin to listen to music thru your phone without any headphones... sounded ok, but unbalanced with little to no bass. I didn't really mind too much, considering how much I spent on the product. BUT while listening to my 4th record, the speakers stopped producing adequate volume in the middle of a song. I didn't pick it up, move it, hit it or shake it... the volumed just cut almost completely out. I have it turned up all the way and I can barley hear anything. I can obviously only speak from my own experience, but I think you might be able to find something a little better for the same price.

CommentsTitle: Very Nice Just A Few Issues That Takes The Star Rating Down
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2021
CommentsContent: Received this turntable today.. Very nice but just a few issues.. 1.. I had to take off the lid coz the record ALBUMS were rubbing on the lid as they played.. Mostly the 180 gram albums.. Removed lid now sounds great.. 2.. The sound may not please everyone.. Again luckily i bought speakers which would advise people to do.. Even so you will save money.. If you are in small room or apartment this will work wonders.. It feels so good to use records again after 20 plus years.. Very much memories since very early childhood.. If you can live with things i mentioned then this is a fantastic deal.. Soon we will get a better one for living room and use this in the bedroom.. Happy New Year one and all.. Be well healthy and safe..

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2019
CommentsContent: This earns 5 stars because of what you get for the price. To start with the bad: the sound sucks, everything about it feels cheap.The good: it’s a less than a $50 record player, it has built in speakers (bad speakers, but speakers none the less), plays 3 different speeds, rca or 3.5mm output, and it’s compact. I have mine connected to a Vizio soundbar set up (rca), and it sounds just fine.For the money, this thing is amazing! As good as a $300+ record player? No, definitely not. If you have $300 for a good record player and another $300 for the necessary sound system, do that (all seriousness, do it, your records and ears will thank you). But if you want a cheap and compact way to play your records, this is the way to go.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 10, 2019
CommentsContent: Product is very attractive but that is the only good thing i can say about it. The sound quality is terrible and i was worried my record was actually being damaged while it was playing. Even with it hooked up to an external amp and speakers it sounded awful. Sound was tinny and scratchy. Also the platter wasnt flat so the record sounded warped as it played. Very disappointed with this item.

CommentsTitle: It "works" but that isn't what's important.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2021
CommentsContent: I'm no audiophile, but this things sounds awful. The tone arm seem to be way too light. Any heavy base barely comes through and turning the volume up to compensate vibrates the plate, adding more issues. You don't get better sound from plugging in headphones. Curiously the music still faintly comes from the inside the unit when headphones are plugged in. Not worth almost 50 bucks. Spend more and get a better turntable. I regret this purchase.

CommentsTitle: Stopped working after I used it maybe 4 times
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 8, 2020
CommentsContent: Easily portable with the exception that you have to keep it plugged in to use it, so you have to carry the charger tooSound quality was alright with the exception that my bar was not heavy enough so I had to weigh it down with some coinsI couldn't connect to anything with the bluetoothDoesn't work any more. Even if I plug it in, it won't  charge, rendering it useless. Unfortunately missed the return window on this. Would have been nice to be able to actually listen to a full record on this.

CommentsTitle: You get what you pay for
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2019
CommentsContent: Well now, let's start off with, the records won't play well without gluing the base of the table down. I've had two of these things and it's the same every time. Not only that but on one of them, the speakers have gone dead and it's not like I've played it on full tilt, ever. I've had it for maybe a year. The other, more recent one is still working fine. But if you need a record player for any vinyl, maybe use one that would be more reliable. Might be more money, but will last much longer.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 21, 2019
CommentsContent: I was so disappointed with this purchase. I love my records and bought this one for my office. The sound was horrible and it was so wobbly that I was afraid it would actually damage my records. I returned it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 26, 2019
CommentsContent: I liked that this recorder player is portable. The color was cute, I liked the features but I ended up returning it due to design and sound. I didn’t like that the vinyl record sticks out beyond the case which means the top can possibly fall down in the record. There is no safety latch to keep it propped open. The sound wasn’t great for us either. I got another model of the same brand that encloses the record fully and sounds better.

CommentsTitle: Worked well at first, then at approx. 60 days, began skipping uncontrollably
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 10, 2020
CommentsContent: Did not expect much for the price. At first, it played LPs just fine, then it began skipping. (note--we did not use it excessively, only played it a couple dozen times, at most). Tried taping a penny or two to the stylus arm, but to no avail. Could not return to Amazon because return window had closed. Contacted vendor, and after much difficulty, they agreed to let me return at my expense for them to evaluate. Unfortunately, the cost of shipping was as much or more than value of the unit. Buyer beware!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 10, 2020
CommentsContent: It’s an alright beginners LP player. The sounds quality via the built in speakers sound cheap. If you have 1 particle of dust on your vinyl then expect your music to skip. I’ve used brand new LP’s on this and it still skips.When connected to another audio source you can still hear music coming from the built in speakers which is just odd.I do love how it’s built and portable. You can plug this record player into a battery pack and it’ll play.Great record player for kids.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 20, 2020
CommentsContent: I love this record player! It’s my first one and I bought 5 records already! I recommend this product to anyone. Great sound quality and you can hear it from several rooms away even if the volume isn’t all the way up. Great price and great size. It fits perfectly on my small shelf and the records all are underneath it. I will be buying more records!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 25, 2017
CommentsContent: I bought this as a Christmas gift to my mom who hadn’t listened to her records since the 1980’s. She teared up when it started playing and danced around the house like she was 18 years old again. We easily got it hooked up to her stereo system using an aux chord and it really sounded phenomenal, plus her favorite color is purple so it really was the perfect gift. Even the built in speakers don’t sound terrible! Thank you so much.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 17, 2020
CommentsContent: If you think your going to have great sound quality or be able to connect this record player to wireless Bluetooth Speakers, you are sadly mistaken. I thought the same thing... You have to connect some good quality speakers to the rear connecting ports. The small speakers in the front do play the music and sound decent, but they are not the greatest. Also if you want to play music from your phone, (Amazon Music, Pandora, etc) then you can connect to the record player via Bluetooth.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2020
CommentsContent: I realize you get what you pay for, but you would expect a record player would be able to do one fundamental thing...play records without them skipping.  The sound quality, even through headphones, is pretty abysmal.  My daughter loves the Union Jack design and puts up with the lo-fi sound quality since this isn't her primary means of listening to music...it's more of a novelty.Because it's more decoration than anything else did we decide to keep it.  She knows that if she wants something that actually works, she'll have to spend some real money.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2019
CommentsContent: For the price, this is a very good buy.Sound quality is on the mediocre to poor side. Could add some base for a much better audio experience. I'm judging this against my parents old...very old record player that is 50+ years old (not the new dolby digital) and the sound quality is much better than this new record player. Twin speaker set-up against twin speakers. My parents old system blows this one away for quality.Ease of use is great on this system. Very adaptable.Seems to be made of good quality material but haven't had it for long so can't say anything concerning longevity.My daughter loves it and that is the most important rating of all.But for the money, I don't think you can go wrong with this.I do recommend this product.

CommentsTitle: Bluetooth is not what you think
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2020
CommentsContent: -1 star for mediocre sound. Maybe its a speaker quality issue, as others have raved about the sound they get.-1 star for lack of a useful Bluetooth connectivity. As others have mentioned, Bluetooth is only for audio input, not output. Why anyone would want to connect their phone/tablet/iPod to these mediocre speakers is beyond me.Go spend $12 on a Bluetooth transmitter that connects to the 3.5mm headphone jack any you’ll finally have the inexpensive turntable you’re looking for.3 stars for portability, storage, price

CommentsTitle: It's simple, cheap, stylish, and it works
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 14, 2020
CommentsContent: I lost all my records in a house fire while I was in college, and recently got gifted a vinyl record from one of my favorite artists, so obviously had to buy a record player! This one was small enough to fit in my bedroom, and I'm a sucker for these little suitcase style turntables.Just make sure you buy a 7 inch slipmat for it! I thought something was wrong with the turntable or that my records had something wrong with them, but it was just the height on the player without a mat.At first, bought one that was too big, and it didn't sit correctly on the frame, but after I got my 7 inch mat (which was luckily cheaper, and was able to return the larger one), it played like a dream!Really missed having the pop and crackle of a vinyl record coming from the corner of my room!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 25, 2020
CommentsContent: It was very easy to set this record player up, and within minutes, we were listening to music.  The sound produced by the built-in speakers is pretty clear, and although some of the previous reviews recommend a slip mat, this doesn't seem necessary because the turntable has small rubber spots that hold the record in place.  We also didn't have any issues regarding the records skipping as some of the other reviews pointed out.  One thing to note is that the record player does seem very fragile, and needs to be handled with considerable care.  In my opinion, this is definitely not something for children.  However, even though it doesn't compare to my $250 Gemini turntable (I wouldn't expect it to), it's a cool, relatively compact device to put in a place that your traditional record player set-up may not fit.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2017
CommentsContent: I purchased this for my 15 year old son. He absolutely loves it. I was afraid the speakers wouldn’t be up to par, but they sound great and are loud enough to hear. I only gave it 4 stars because the 45 adapter which should have been included was missing and, except for putting in for a total exchange, I can find no way to contact anyone to have that one little piece sent to us. I had to lay out more money to purchase the discs separately. I was not pleased about that at all. But, the product itself is more than I expected.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 23, 2020
CommentsContent: BeforeThis is how it arrived, I’m afraid to open it. I don’t think anything else needs to be said. Refer to the photos first.AfterSo I decided to open it an to my surprise everything worked perfectly which is why ima keep it at 3, but tbh it is unacceptable to ship something and have it arrive like that even just putting that box in a box would of prevented a lot of the damages.

CommentsTitle: Great record player for the price!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2021
CommentsContent: Just got this and have used it once, but so far it’s great! Very easy to set up and comes with detailed instructions inside the player. The speakers aren’t amazing or anything, but they’re decent for record player speakers, and it’s nice to not have to hook it up to external speakers if you don’t want to. Haven’t tried the bluetooth or line in functions yet so will update, but the plain old record player function is excellent so far. Super light and portable, and love the color.

CommentsTitle: WOW! This is a great deal!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 11, 2018
CommentsContent: I was hesitant to buy this because I had purchased a Crosley some years ago and didn't get much use out of it as it did not have the bluetooth capability this one does. I gotta tell ya, I couldn't believe the quality of this little doo-dad for the price! They actually did the Victrola name proud. It plays records just dandy, has an automatic off for those of us who don't remember you need to remove the needle from the record, has plugs for connecting to bigger speakers, and of course, the bluetooth capability that lets you stream your iTunes through this snazzy looking retro gizmo. I'd definitely buy it again for a gift if I knew another soul as anachronistically inclined as myself.

CommentsTitle: Cheap way to spin your vinyl
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 10, 2018
CommentsContent: Cheap way to spin your old vinyl.  I got a great deal on it as I ordered the camouflage record player. It was about half the price of the nicer looking colors.  Mine arrived in perfect condition.  The unit is well built from canvas covered "wood" with steel corner protection.  When I played my first couple records on it, it skipped a little bit. I solved that by putting a small weight on top of the needle - maybe an ounce or two (couple nuts).  Sound is tinny and no bass from the built in speakers.  It is acceptable for some.  Other than that, it played very well.  Extremely portable and easy to set up.I'm going to hook it up to my big stereo system so that should take care of the audio quality.  I will eventually buy a nicer unit but grabbed this because of the deal.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2019
CommentsContent: On my 2nd one, same issue. Doesn't play newer(even unopened  rand new records) or colored records. Only plays 80's and older records, the rest just constantly skip.  JunkUpdate:replaced the needle and my skipping problems have gone away for now. very cheap fix. got the needles here on amazon.https://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B01K10DISO/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o01_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this against my better judgement, thinking that the difference between a cheap record player and a more expensive turn table wouldn't be significant.  My records all skipped like crazy on this - it was not even enjoyable to listen to anything because of the skipping and poor sound quality.  I thought the issue was my records - were they all just that dusty?  I was gifted a much higher quality turntable from another brand and tried the records that were almost impossible to listen to on this device - no issues at all on that one, everything sounded great... so the issue was 100% this device.  Sad I wasted the money on it.  It's a cute little thing, but it doesn't do the job.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2021
CommentsContent: I wanted a small table top record played for my bedroom and didn't want to spend a ton of money. This player is perfect for my needs! The sound quality is good for what it is, clearly this is not a high-end sound system but for someone who usually just plays music on my computer or phone, I think this record player sounds great. I haven't tested out the Bluetooth function (and don't know if I will anytime soon) so can't speak on that. I will say if you are looking for a compact personal player to enjoy your records, I think this one is a good choice and I'm very happy with my purchase.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2021
CommentsContent: Great value.  Amazing features incl stylus lift, auto stop.  speakers are a bit small & tinny, as expected, but output jacks allow bookshelf adders.  Easy to use.  Very pleased.  Book doesn't ID all the shipping protection.  Most are obvious, but note:. The arm has a hold-down clip, and the stylus has a removeable cover.  Only diappointment is no bass/treble control (didn't expect an equalizer at this price)

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 26, 2019
CommentsContent: Although the sound quality was great for the price of the item, it is pure crap other than that. The turntable was wobbly in play causing my records/LPs to skip. No there was nothing wrong with my LPs, any record that I put on the turntable they skipped or repeated the same section. I would not waste my time or money, just a poor quality record player.

CommentsTitle: Do not expect this to play via Bluetooth through your own speakers.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 25, 2017
CommentsContent: This is very deceiving. You are not able to use the Bluetooth function to hear your album on good speakers, BUT, you can connect another device to "vintage speaker" that shows up on the Bluetooth list and play music from your device with the speakers on the record player. When I bought it, I thought the album would play through my Bose speakers via Bluetooth. So...this was disappointing to say the least. I think you can line in an external speaker though. It plays very nicely and the speakers on it are sufficient for our 11 year old to use for her introduction to record albums.

CommentsTitle: How to make this player worth while
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 14, 2020
CommentsContent: Let’s cut to the chase. The speakers are horrible if you want sonic range and depth, but that doesn’t mean this product is useless. You didn’t really expect Bose quality speakers for the price, did you? Ah but that’s where this product can be saved. Go buy some Bose or JBL portable speaker and then you can line out from the record player to the speaker to have some quality. Let record player do it’s job and spin the vinyl and get some real portable speakers for the sound - it’s only way to save the music. You will then be happy with this product if you were aiming for the whole portable “I’m gonna subject my friends to neutral milk hotel on their back deck gathering” record player thing.If you however want a record player for your home and you are serious about playing vinyl on a regular basis, go get a real turntable with a quality tone-arm that as the counter weight and anti-skate features. Your records deserve better on the home front. Happy spinning 😎

CommentsTitle: Defective. Do not recommend overseas shipping.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 23, 2019
CommentsContent: Have to return item because it is defective. It does not turn on yes I followed instructions. I also do not like how it came packaged just in its manufactured box. There was no other boxing or assurance it was just the retailer box like you buy at a store in person. Its unsettling because shipping an item overseas there should be better product protection. With that being noted I was so ecstatic now just im just disappointed.

CommentsTitle: Albums sound warped and they skip
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2020
CommentsContent: We have bought and returned 4 albums that either sounded warped or skipped on this player. There is no way we just got 4 bad albums. As a blue tooth speaker, it sounds great and looks cute. But horrible as an record player. Wish I could return but past the window by the time we realized it was the player and not the albums.

CommentsTitle: OK. You get what you pay for.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2021
CommentsContent: Came in the mail with a hole in the box. Plugged it in to see what the sound quality was like and it had no sound at all. Took it apart to find the speakers were unplugged and out of position. Fixed that and it works, but the sound quality is poor. Ended up plugging in my Bose speaker for a better quality. Ok system for someone just getting into vinyl.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2021
CommentsContent: I was really excited to buy this product because my brother got me my first vinyl for Christmas. I didn't do much research before looking on Amazon, but I knew since it was my first record player I wanted something on the cheaper side. I found this one and the reviews were good, so I wanted to give it a try. Setting it up was easy to follow and the color is very pretty. I was really delighted at first, but then the sound quality got really weird. There was a buzzing sound, and that sound was still apparent when I turned the volume down. Then, it skipped! I was really disappointed and did some research on how to fix this. I found that I needed to adjust the anti-skate control. Well this cheap record player doesn't have that. I thought maybe there was some dirt or dust stuck in the record so I invested in the Boundless Record Brush (I recommend). Nope, both problems were still there. Honestly, even if it is your first record player, buy something a little more expensive. It's cheap for a reason.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 3, 2018
CommentsContent: I have had 3 victrolas all of my needles have been weak and scratches some of my vinyl from this brand. I have had to sadly switch brands to a more expensive option to save my collection. This last purple glitter 3 speed I bought couldn't fit a 12 lp and hindered the record from playing. I thought it was going to chip.

CommentsTitle: Cheaply Made, no mat included. Better off buying a higher end product
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 22, 2020
CommentsContent: I was so excited about this product. It is so cute and the perfect size, comes with built in speakers. The product description sounded great. However does not come with a platter mat or a slipmat. The arm is lightweight. I have not been able to use it without it skipping immediately. I think this is because of the cheap, lightweight arm. All of my records are brand new and I haven’t been able to play a single one. I recommend paying more for a better product that includes everything you need up front because in buying the platter mat and the slipmat, I ended up paying an additional $40 and still it doesn’t play.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 8, 2019
CommentsContent: I love it, love it! 💕. It’s old and new put together. I can play music off my phone by Bluetooth or buy records. It was all very easy to operate, I was surprised it took less than 5 mins to get the music playing. It’s made really well and I’m so pleased the sound quality has that old ring to it that travels to a time I only see in movies.I tired to download a video but it wasn’t letting me. Trust me it sounds amazing

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2021
CommentsContent: Do NOT buy this record player. I bought it thinking it would be an okay starter record player, wasn't expecting fireworks or the best player but at least a decent record player and I certainly expected the record player to function without damaging the vinyls. I was wrong, this player has ruined one of my vinyls and IS NOT WORTH buying. Get a different player do not make the mistake I did. I even attempted to clean the needle and the record was new so it's 100% the player

CommentsTitle: Best value for beginners/Budget audiophiles. You must upgrade it. See below. Speakers suck.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 31, 2020
CommentsContent: Good beginner/Budget deck. To improve sound you must immediately do the following: Best value upgrades: install Banpa Flip stylus ($10) if you play real 78s. change to BSR NEEDLE STYLUS ST-16 ST-17 ST-17D ST17 ST17D ST17DLP ST-18 ST19 ST-20 ST-21($9). See youtube videos for tips.  Buy 7"rubber slipmat from Amazon to reduce static. Record player: Victrola suitcase VSC 550BT. Improves sound as much as you can on a BUDGET! Flip head reduces changing cartridges. Replace your belt, use a record weight, hook to real speakers.  Enjoy! Upgrade later to a better player!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 6, 2019
CommentsContent: I'm kind of new to the vinyl scene so i'm by far no expert, but for the price this record player has everything i need. Speakers have a good sound and the volume adjusts fairly high. Plays the vinyls fine far as i can. Bluetooth works with no issues, has a headphone jack and an aux cord jack. Also, you can connect external speakers to it. It's smaller than it appeared in the pictures to me, but that's great because it's very portable and easy to carry/move. I think for the price it's a fantastic piece!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 20, 2020
CommentsContent: Arrived broken.  It was supposed to be a  gift for my 14 yr old on her birthday.  So not only did she have to cancel her party because of the Corona Virus, but her big gift didn't  work.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 16, 2020
CommentsContent: Awful sound. The sound on this item was really bad. The Volume button won't let you turn music lower, just med and high volume. The turntable stops for no reason and the volume stops during playing for no reason. So frustrating. I would give this zero stars if I could. I don't leave negative reviews lightly, but in this case, I feel the quality is so poor that I have to do it. Buyers beware!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2021
CommentsContent: We have not been able to use it yet - we've spent more than an hour very carefully trying to fit the black cartridge holder into its slot in the arm. As received, this part, with the red stylus installed, was hanging loose from the arm, inside a small plastic bag. (During the struggle to install it, the red plastic piece that holds the needle popped out, and is presently safely waiting for us to get the black carrier popped into its slot in the end of the arm.) Very careful examination using  bright lights and a magnifier show that the black plastic slot tin the end of the arm, that the black needle carrier block is supposed to fit into, is ever so slightly too small to receive the piece. We have tried applying a small bit of force to pop it in, but so far to no avail. I am happy to write a good review if and when this issue is resolved. Right now I am taking a break. Super frustrating.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 2, 2020
CommentsContent: Sorry but the sound quality is awful. It sounds like you are under water no matter how loud you play it. I’m really gutted because I was excited to buy records for this but it would honestly be a complete waste of money

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 26, 2019
CommentsContent: We grandparents purchased this turntable for a 4yo granddaughter. It is much too delicate for her. This statement is actually a compliment. The quality is excellent but delicate. A 4yo needs guidance in how to lift and set the delicate arm. This player seems way better than its inexpensive price. The player has ports for external speakers and headphones. I've downgraded the sound quality because the two included stereo speakers are too small for full 20-20,000 Hz reproduction, but fine for portable listening. Except for the two small speakers, the platter, needle, arm, lift are near professional quality.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 26, 2020
CommentsContent: This is a great record player for beginners. The sound is decent. The moving parts are smooth. My big disappointment was with the color. The color that was delivered was nothing like the color I chose online, as you can see in the photos. It’s hideous. Being that it’s part of our decor, the color was one of our main considerations when purchasing, and I’m extremely disappointed.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2021
CommentsContent: I bought this one year ago.  It's hardly been used, but now that my daughter has a few records, we've discovered that it skips badly, even on new records.  I just submitted a complaint to the company, so we'll see if this gets resolved.  But right now, it's just looking like it's too late to return it, and that I might have an unusable turntable.  This makes me think that you may just get what you pay for..... lots of bells and whistles, and pretty colors, that won't matter if you cant actually PLAY RECORDS ON IT.

CommentsTitle: Customer service will help if you have a problem
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 30, 2020
CommentsContent: I was going to rate this 5 but back in August when I ordered it it worked well when I went to use it yesterday 9/30/20 it stoped working I'm upset about it and I did call customer service and they r refunding me witch is great but I wish I could've just got a replacement but I am thankful I'm getting my refund 🙂 so a will say I give the customer service A+ on there help on correcting this situation now just waiting on my refund .

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2020
CommentsContent: This is designed to play older vinyls. Most vinyl now is 180 grams. This junk has a super light arm so to even attempt to play modern records, you have to tape a penny to the arm. If you're lucky, they play through the first time. But have no fear-by the 5th play through, the record will start skipping. If you aren't lucky, this will just damage your records.So, if you only have records from the 80s or before you should be fine. But if you're living in this century and half your records are the heavy-duty new ones, enough not listening to half your collection.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2019
CommentsContent: sadly disappointed in the product, it has a rattle inside like something is loose and it came without the 45 adapter. The vinily wrap it has is peeling off from the corners without any use, sound quality is good but no exceptional. the packaging is very nice and the overall exterior look, but it ends there.i was expecting a little more for the price.if i had to buy another record player i would go with something with a higher quality.bottom line - I do not recommend it

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 15, 2021
CommentsContent: This product seemed to work just fine, but now it doesn’t play very well after about a week of use. There isn’t much control over the speed, which is good for beginners, but it becomes a problem when neither of the settings (fast or regular) play the correct speed. It might be because of an error in manufacturing but it looks like their might be something wrong with the mechanism when it spins making it sound strange. Still a nice looking record player and good for a temporary replacement, but not the greatest for an everyday use.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2020
CommentsContent: My daughter is getting into vinyl records. She’s used my turntable here at my house but wanted something for her dorm room. I got her this and she was quite pleased. I remembered the suitcase record players of the 60s and thought this might be some of the same, but the sound quality is actually quite good and the head weight of the cartridge isn’t excessive enough to hurt her record collection.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2019
CommentsContent: If you’re thinking of buying this, go for it! After shopping around for one of these I started to get a little overwhelmed by the options and decided to pick one I felt a little confident in and just go for it. I’m so glad it was this one because I’m so pleased. The sound is phenomenal and the blue is super adorable. It’s easy and pretty straightforward to use so no worries there (some of the other options I looked at were super confusing on the how to use terms). So far I’m loving it. I’d definitely recommend this

CommentsTitle: The color is VERY off from the pictures
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 12, 2018
CommentsContent: They really should take new photos, I was surprised to open the box to a VERY bright/saturated turquoise, nothing like the robin's egg color shown in the images. For the price, surely it's not worth returning, so I'll settle even though it doesn't match my living room color scheme. The speakers are OK, 3/5. It's a beautiful piece, though and should work just fine for what I need it for.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this to give my kids some appreciation for the sound of music on vinyl during this pandemic. They were thrilled. There has been some varied success with some of the vinyl purchased through Amazon; which I suppose is to be expected.

CommentsTitle: Great sound in a small machine
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2021
CommentsContent: Victrola was always a quality manufacturer from years ago. Nice coloring, sleek style make it a welcome addition to a room. When you register it online, the company will even send you an extra needle. Lets me listen to my old records from the 70s and 80s. Wish it had a CD player however. Have so many old discs that I would like to listen to. All in all a quality product. Great sound.

CommentsTitle: "So wonderful, you'll adore it." VS reference haha
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2020
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   I love this Victrola! It plays my records perfectly and everything is already set up nicely, so there's not much you have to do to start playing right away. The sound quality is very good, it plays music clearly, maybe slightly screechy at first but it adjusts, plus it gets LOUD! I really enjoy it. It's not an automatic tone arm, you'll have to manipulate it manually but it rocks.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 4, 2019
CommentsContent: I've been wanting one of these for a really long time, and decided to treat myself for a birthday present. It arrived way earlier than expected because I thought the color I ordered was on back order. It took me about 5 minutes to figure out how to use and not gonna lie I'm not impressed. I'm not sure if it was just a flaw that mine has or if it's every single model- but the sound quality is awful. The speakers are crackly, to the point where it sounds like they've been blown out.  If it weren't for that I'd absolutly give 5 stars on everything.

CommentsTitle: Bluetooth works in the wrong direction. Stupid and useless.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2020
CommentsContent: When I bought this “Bluetooth Record Player” I foolishly assumed that the Bluetooth connection would allow the user to connect the player to a set of headphones to listen in privacy. WRONG. The Bluetooth connection works in the wrong direction. It allows you to play an outside source through the Record Player’s speakers, but does not allow you to play the record player out to another headset or speaker. This is the most idiotic use of Bluetooth that I’ve ever seen.

CommentsTitle: Great gift and excellent purchase decision!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 18, 2020
CommentsContent: Great Father’s Day Gift!  Our 80 year old dad wanted to enjoy his albums and when researching this player it had so  many great reviews we decided to go for it.  The cost was very reasonable.  What surprised us was that we thought we would need to connect our Bose and we didn’t!  Dad uses it every day and because it is portable he can bring it to any room in the house.  Last note if a record was even a bit scratched or warped we did not try to play it as extra precautions.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 6, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased this item and gave it to my daughter for her bday. The table is in even so the records skip. The website doesn’t load and I can’t get thru on the number. It didn’t come with any info so now I don’t have a way to replace it or get my money back.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2021
CommentsContent: So im just going to be straight up honest... I was super excited about getting the record player in the mail, i waited day by day for it to arrive. When it FINALLY did i saw the mail lady carrying it to our front step and i immediately saw the box was destroyed. The mail lady even said, " i was super careful with it, i hope its okay." That upset me because there was holes and i looked like a disaster waiting to happen. Once i opened it i was surprised that everything was there and in good shape. The only complaints i really have is that the record does sound a tad scratchy and skips parts of the records put on it. Also when i first opened it there was a few small stains on the white parts but it wasnt to big of a deal. I like it and thinks it looks really nice in my room and a cool way to listen to my favorite artists!

CommentsTitle: Poor sound quality and not durable
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2019
CommentsContent: We bought this not expecting much and we were still disappointed.  The sound quality is really poor.  We’ve had it for not quite 2 years, have only used it less than once a month because it sounds so bad, went to use it today and it will no longer even turn on.

CommentsTitle: Just what I was looking for!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 7, 2018
CommentsContent: I love this little Victrola suitcase record player! I recently inherited all of my dad's old records, and I needed an reliable but inexpensive record player so I could listen to them to remember my childhood. This turntable completely fit the bill. Not only does it work very well with pretty good built-in speakers, but I flipping love the retro look. I'll try to add a photo later. It's pretty handy that I can also play my digital music through this, but all I really want to do is listen to my vinyl like I did in the old days. To say I am happy is an understatement. I am in serious love!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2018
CommentsContent: My husband I used this record player once and it worked beautifully.  However, we went to use it a second time and the cue lever is stuck.  This is just not acceptable.  A cue lever should not stick after one use.  We did not move the unit at all.  It has not been jostled in any way.  We will be returning this unit for something better.

CommentsTitle: Great item, but didn't come with the 45 adapter!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2020
CommentsContent: I know it probably doesn't deserve the 1 star rating just for not having the 45 adapter, but now I have to go through all the hassle of either returning it or just not having the ability to play my 45 speed records....  If you are going to state that it comes with certain parts, it should come with those parts, otherwise it makes it a pain!!!!!

CommentsTitle: If you are old enough like me you know Victrola LOL
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2017
CommentsContent: This was a Christmas gift for my cousin who was missing her late dad, she wanted to play some of his old records and she loves the color purple. She was almost in tears when she saw this. Pro tip lol when trying to connect to this device via Bluetooth, you have to be ready to pair it right away. If you miss the window turn the device to Phono or away from Bluetooth and then back and you should see it show up in your Bluetooth scan. The speakers are not very loud but they are crisp. Vinyl should sound very nice through this. You also have a Mic input as well as RCA out in the back of the unit so you should be able to pump this through your home audio system.

CommentsTitle: 4 problems with this HORRIBLE record player
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 3, 2019
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   I got this Record player especially for the color and rose gold detailing and that’s literally the only thing I still like about it...other than that bad buy for a beginners player; I purchased this one specifically twice in row first time had to return it since it had horrible skipping defect, that actually ruined my brand new vinyl. The second time same problem, on top of a nasty dent on the back side since it was delivered to me in just the old/used looking victrola package box with a sticker label on the front. I don’t understand why amazon would ever do that but anyway, overall really upset that I had such a bad experience both times, and wish I didn’t have to return it because I love the color.

CommentsTitle: Great little turntable for the price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 19, 2019
CommentsContent: This is an awesome little turntable, but guess what?  The sound isn't that great, whoa!!  Yea because the speakers are like 2" wide!  I can't believe some reviews are complaining about "no bass"!! LOL, yeah because the speakers are like 2" wide!!  Geez!  For $35 what did you expect?!  Anyway, great little turntable, sound is decent, hopefully it will last a while :-)  P.S. the speakers are like 2" wide!!  lol....

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2020
CommentsContent: Yes, this is definitely an entry level record player. For some reason I thought the sound would be decent enough but, like everyone had said, you get what you pay for. The player has a nice look to it but this is essentially a toy. I'm no audio snob but I need my records to sound close to what I listened to as a kid.  I'm trying out the AT 60.

CommentsTitle: Had to return the 1st Record Player
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 10, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this record player for my partner for his Christmas, and he absolutely loved it!  The record player is easy to use, and also has support for Bluetooth, and auxillary.  However, you'll definitely want to use external speakers for this player as the sound quality isn't the best.After two weeks of using the record player, it stopped working ... We were able to get a replacement shipment quickly.  We haven't had any issues with the new record player since.Overall, this is a great product if you are buying it as a gift for someone who wants to start a record collection.  If you're purchasing this for audiophiles, you may want to consider a product with better quality.

CommentsTitle: Only worked for a few months, Company does not honor 1 year warranty
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 25, 2020
CommentsContent: I was satisfied with purchase but after a few months the record player would no longer turn on. The company told me it was probably a bad power supply and they sent me a new power supply. I have written them multiple times to inform them that this did not fix the problem. They do not bother to respond. My one year warranty ends Dec 2020, I assume they are just waiting to say my warranty has expired. Very disappointed in Victrola.  They do not stand by behind their warranty.

CommentsTitle: Like throwing money down the drain
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 28, 2021
CommentsContent: Gifted this to my dad, broke within 3 days. Reached out to Victrola support, they said hold the product and we will ship you another power adapter to ensure the power is working. After 3 weeks I get the adapter during which I was no longer for amazon refund. Tested with the new adapter, the issue was not the adapter but the power unit within the device. I responded back with this and they just ignored my 3 attempts to reach out for next steps to either give me a refund or ship another device.Waste of my time and money.  Never again shall my family or I buy another Victrola product.Gifted https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07PBLD4QN/ref=ox_sc_act_title_2?smid=ATVPDKIKX0DER&psc=1 to my dad so he can continue to enjoy his gift. He loves the Sony PS-LX310BT and still working after several months.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2021
CommentsContent: Amazing Quality Record Player. I have zero complaints. Love the vintage look of this compact record player. Our family looks forward enjoying the use of this player for many years to come. Every aspect of this device seems to be top quality. Plus comes with an extra needle. You will love this record player! It is a must have for your entertainment! The nostalgia is perfect.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 24, 2020
CommentsContent: Very easy to use, especially for a novice like me, and the sound quality was excellent.  Docked a star because mine didn't come with the 45 RPM adapter; when I contacted customer support stating that the 45 RPM adapter was missing they said they would send one out.  About 6 weeks later I received an AC wall plug adapter and they haven't returned any followup emails.Update: they sent me a 45 RPM adapter

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2019
CommentsContent: Really disappointed, i got this as a birthday gift from my husband,  i basically shop on this site alot,  and never really do reviews,  but when you get irritated from after spending alot of money,  and your item dont work right its upsetting.  I wanted to start a record vinyl collection as well.  Not as cheap as i remembed. Anyways my record player is perfact like picture,  but my record wobbles a bit during play time ,  and skips vinyle records,  brand new.  Ive only tried 33 . But every record ive gotton skips.  I dont recommend this.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2021
CommentsContent:

   It has bluetooth but I do not use it to preserve the vintage aesthetic!! I love it, and it took some time to learn just a day or less and I was jamming eventually. Each deep line is a song, maybe you knew this, I didnt know. Just put the needle before the deep dark groove line and that should be the beginning of each song.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2019
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   I was super excited but it skips like crazy! I thought it was maybe the vinyl was damaged so I replaced  it and nope it's the player same exact issues. Honestly I'm more disappointed than anything

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2019
CommentsContent: So disappointed in what we received. There was no packing material inside the box so our product was bouncing around. The merchandise box was opened and ripped. No instructions no Manuel and missing parts. Did not turn on and was hot after 30 minutes plugged in and us trying to figure out how to turn it on. It should turn on when we turned it to ON but it did nothing, no light turned on. It was for my son and he researched watching videos and searching Manuel’s. Highly disappointed in the way the product was packaged and came defective. I can’t even rate my disappointment.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this for my dad as a Christmas gift in 2018 and he absolutely loved it! It was perfect. Had the retro look and feel that he likes and it worked great. Sounded great. Now, a little over a year later it has suddenly stopped working. When you try to play a record, it plays it way too fast even on the lowest setting. He doesn’t even use this that often for the belt to have gotten super worn. Very disappointed in this. Especially since my family has worked to build up his record collection because he loved it so much. Will definitely be doing more research before I buy him a new one.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 27, 2020
CommentsContent: The device itself works fine, looks good and it’s relatively easy to use, the Bluetooth functionality is cool and it even includes a 45mm adapter.The speakers are by far the weakest point, even my laptop (MacBook Pro 15) or my $20 mono bluetooth speaker (JBL go) sounds better and louder. So just connect it to a decent set of speakers.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2021
CommentsContent: I love love love this! I have been flirting with the idea of getting a suitcase player for about a year, I have another one but its big and I love the suitcase model. The shipping was super fast, it looked gorgeous when it got here, and I was kind of surprised by how loud the speakers were able to get. Overall, this is definitely one of the best purchases Ive made in a while.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2021
CommentsContent: The product didn't work. This was the 2nd one my famiñy bought and both had the same problem. The first one was a Christmas gift and when she opened it on jan 1, no light and no spinning. My mom thought it was too late to return the first one so I purchased my a sister another one. It arrived Jan 19 and opened it Jan 20th. This product had the same issue. We check both products in various outlets and even tried a diffferent cord. I am returning the Jan 19 one but just stuck with a lost on the first purchase.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 1, 2020
CommentsContent: I always wanted my own turntable for vinyl records, and Victrola has provided me with this wonderful turntable. It comes in a suitcase, compact enough to have all of the things you need to play a record.  The sound is great, but I speak as someone whose first experience is with this particular turntable without any other speakers. It's a great turntable for everyone, especially if you're looking to have it set in your bedroom for personal enjoyment.

CommentsTitle: Great looking, great portability but records skip too much
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2020
CommentsContent: Purchased this item for portability and easy, affordable access to playing vinyl records that I'm quickly amassing from thrift stores and estate sales.  Price was very attractive and Victrola brand is legendary, so thought I couldn't go wrong.  Novelty British flag design was an added plus.Received incorrect style of the item (no British flag rather, a solid, black velvet case) - but nevertheless gave it a spin.  5 of the 10 records I played skipped horribly - particularly on the first half of each side.  I suspect it has something to do with the design - 33 1/3 LP records actually extend out beyond the record platform and cabinet, so I think lack of stability underneath the vinyl is an issue - and results in needle kicking up - particularly if there is a slight warp to the record (which many vintage records have).  Returned the item and purchased another Victrola model (VTA-65) that has better support underneath LP's and so far have had no issues with skipping.  All the records that skipped on this model didn't on the VTA-65.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2017
CommentsContent: I was a bit worried ordering this because the reviews are somewhat all over the place but was very relieved to find it works fantastically. Looks good, sounds good, also works with Bluetooth very easily- only things I can say for some of the reviews saying there was no proper sound is possibly getting a defective one or maybe they didn't take off the protective piece over the stylus (or needle) also make sure your records are dust free as bits of dust can create pops and crackles. Oh I forgot to mention this thing can go pretty dang loud and thats awesome.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2019
CommentsContent: So upset. Ordered this as a Christmas gift and when they put in the record the sound was horrible!!! It made the background music sound distorted and “wavy?”Anyways, I wouldn’t recommend this. I’m returning it and going with something different. I guess you get what you pay for, but REALLY? what a piece of crap.Also- how embarrassing to give as a gift and hear that it is no good.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2020
CommentsContent: This is good for anything...but a record. The motor does not keep up and it sounds bad. I still use it a decore and to play Bluetooth but I rarely ever use it for my records but that’s what I excepted from a cheap record player.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this for my niece for Christmas, along with a few records, to pass along the vinyl bug. It worked - maybe too well! I definitely created a monster who will need to be fed with new records and musical equipment for the rest of her life. Yay?The price point should tell you that this is no Technics 1200, but if you're looking for a fun gift, a record player for someone just getting started with vinyl, or a supplemental player for yourself (that's also highly portable), you won't go wrong here. There are an abundance of great colors and designs to choose from, and the Bluetooth option is nice. You can also supplement the sound with additional speakers if you'd like, or use your headphones or earbuds. As always, you get what you pay for, but this is a decent value for the low price. One quick caveat:  consider buying a decently sturdy slipmat (the felt, fabric, or cork piece that sits underneath the vinyl on most turntables) to use with this player - it doesn't come with one. I was lucky that I already had backups on hand to include with my niece's gift, because I was uncomfortable with putting vinyl directly on plastic. A slightly thicker slipmat seemed to provide the most stability to balance out the lower-cost components with which these turntables are made. Happy listening!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 31, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this because of all the good reviews.  I have a pretty good collection, and want to be able to play in my office, away from my full stereo system.  I know that suitcase players are the trash of the audio industry, but held out hope that I could get something small and convenient.  Every record skipped.  I have brand new, unopened records that I wanted to give a first spin.  Flawless, no dust, nothing.  Skipping.  No way to adjust anything with the arm.  I dont want the possibility of damaging some of my vintage records, so I am returning this.  Will look into a system to put in my office instead of this portable option.  Dont waste your money.  I should have known better.

CommentsTitle: Best value on the market UPDATED
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 14, 2019
CommentsContent: I gave a 5 star rating.. why? Because the value exceeds to price. You get the best bang for your buck. I‘ve brought it with me to the park and plugged it into my car. Sound quality is 8/10 considering the size of the speaker but who is looking for deep bass anyway? The vinyls play well - I have it on an auto setting. This is a plug and play machine, no exterior speaker needed though you can plug them in. It also gives you an aux port to listen via headphones to get the full vinyl sound. Great product!UPDATED: 3 months later and my Victorila has stopped working. It stopped spinning the records. Won't be purchasing again. You get what you paid for!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2021
CommentsContent: My wife was really looking forward to getting this bit of nostalgia and to look at it the product fulfilled her expectations, BUT the sound that came out of it was absolutely awful. Tinny with no bass. In these days of tiny beautiful sounding speakers why the company couldn't be bothered to use a good speaker in its box was astounding.When the "quality" of the speaker was discovered we thought we'd try to use the Bluetooth to run the sound through other better speakers and the Bluetooth only allowed for receiving and not broadcasting. Why would we want other system's sound coming through this awful speaker?

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this as a gift for my husband and it’s perfect! It worked right out of the box with very minimal setup required, and is so easy to use. The sound is great and it’s extremely user friendly. Love it!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2020
