CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2020
CommentsContent: An inexpensive way to play your vinyls.  For the price, this is a solid unit with dependable internal sound qualities.  It does have the ability to easily plug in external speakers for a better sound.  At this price point, I would definitely recommend this unit.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2020
CommentsContent: I got this for my Grandkids . The sound was good, I wish it had a auto return arm , but for the price it seems to be a decent quality.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2021
CommentsContent: I bought it for my 13 year old granddaughter for Christmas and she received albums from her parents so she very happy!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2020
CommentsContent: I've had my eye on these forever, & am so glad I finally gave in & purchased one. It's great quality & I love that it's portable!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2020
CommentsContent: Skips. Skips on new and old vinyls. Just not right. Read other reviews because it says it all. Now I’m concerned about a refund. Very disappointed as was the recipient.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2020
CommentsContent: The sound is quite thin but what can you expect from a $40 record player.  The Bluetooth input connection seems to have some issues.  I’ve been unable to get a consistent stream.  It stops every 10 seconds for approximately 10 seconds.  Otherwise it’s a good deal

CommentsTitle: very loosely screwed in turntable jammed
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2021
CommentsContent: Wish i could give this zero stars. Both of the ones i ordered were very loosely built, turn plate was jiggly, second one i ordered, same and turntable was jammed and wouldn't spin and when it would it would spin intermittently.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 9, 2019
CommentsContent: This is nearly just what I wanted to play some old records . I wish it had the mechanism that held records above the turntable so I could play records one after the other because I have a lot of 45s. The sound is good and it’s very compact which I like . Overall a cool player for the money

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2018
CommentsContent: I love that it is compact and a carrying case! I took it to ahoq my kids what a victrola looks like and they were so impressed! I love that it includes the bluetooth and aux settings as well. Makes it incredibly valuable! The sound is ok but definitely loud. I had to turn it down a bit though because at max it sounded like speaker was gonna blow. I am happy with this victrola as a starter!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 13, 2019
CommentsContent: I got this as a gift for my Mom. The one time I listened to it, I realized just how poor the built in speakers are. If you want any quality in the audio, you have to buy additional speakers. Would probably be better suited as a novelty gift for a child.

CommentsTitle: Bought as a Gift 6 months ago
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2021
CommentsContent: Bought this for our niece back in July (over 6 months ago) and checked with her over Christmas if the product still works and if she still uses it. She brought it upstairs from her bedroom and put on a record and says she loves it and uses it all the time. She was very excited to show it off.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 11, 2019
CommentsContent: Got this for my boyfriend and he loves it, it adds a great touch to your room and is perfect for playing music. Bluetooth works great the sound isn’t the best and the most clear but it’s not like it is horrible either. It’s great for your room and I think anyone would appreciate this as a gift with their favorite artist/bands vinyl!

CommentsTitle: Lift Lever Stuck in less than 24 hours
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 11, 2021
CommentsContent: I just got my record player and was overjoyed. Worked great but upon second time using it the lift lever stuck in the backwards position and I couldn't get it forward again.Sadly sending it back and going to purchase something with less mixed reviews. Sometimes you should listen to the negativity even with a high star rating.

CommentsTitle: Everything I wanted in a record player
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2020
CommentsContent: Very nice record player .Simple to use and I love listening to my old records .The sound is great and I love that I can take it with me.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2019
CommentsContent: Actually, this is a great value for the price. It’s great for children. It’s great for listening to your old vinyl. However, the sound is more like a small portable radio. That said, I still feel that it is a fine value for the money. If you are looking for full bodied sound, spend more...

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 16, 2021
CommentsContent: Within hours of getting this record player it began making my records sound like they were underwater. By the second day I had it, it was basically completely broken and the speed was all kinds of messed up. I honestly do not recommend this item. Save up a little longer and buy a nicer one. And so your research! I somewhat bought on impulse. Did return.

CommentsTitle: Cheaply made. Does not last long.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 11, 2020
CommentsContent: Bought two for my kids for Christmas 1999. It is now August 2020 and neither one of them still works. Not great quality. Poorly made. I am embarrassed of this purchase.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 6, 2020
CommentsContent: Bought this product for my daughter and her vinyls.  When we receive this player on the first day we tried it. The speakers were distorted and the sound just wasn’t pleasing to the ear.  This product looks good but it is idefinitely not a good quality.  We were in the midst of COVID-19 pandemic and we couldn’t  return this product. I am going to reach out to Amazon now and see if I can return it.

CommentsTitle: Love everything about this Vintage Bluetooth Turntable!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2018
CommentsContent: Love this vintage Bluetooth turntable!Exactly what it describes. It’s everything I thought it should be. I bought it for part of our 7 yr old granddaughters Christmas &  she absolutely loves it! Great sound, very vintage & very affordable! Very impressed! It’s a must have! Highly recommend!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 12, 2020

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 20, 2018

If you want a cute, minimal space invading player, this is for you...the sound was better than expected.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2020
CommentsContent:

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2019

CommentsTitle: Very nice first level record player.

DO NOT BUY!!!

I love this record player and I use it everyday I plan to continue using it everyday too.

CommentsTitle: Almost as if the insides were broken

CommentsTitle: great quality for an affordable cost!!!

The audio out to my stereo worked but that killed the ability to be portable and listen to records. so frustrated. now i have to wait all over again.

Do NOT waste your money on such a terrible product!

CommentsTitle: Lasted 8 months - does not turn on anymore

I even waited a month to write this review to make sure it wasn't a fluke.  Buy at your own risk  :(

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2019

CommentsTitle: quality isn’t great. We’ve had success with all but one of ...

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2019
CommentsContent: Unfortunately the arm/needle is not quite right so it just skips on all the records :( I tried to email the company to see if there was anything that could be done to calibrate it...but never heard back from them.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 13, 2020
CommentsContent: This is a low quality turntable that try’s to lure customers in with the Bluetooth gimmick and cheap price. But you get what you pay for in this case. These cheap turntables have poor quality arms, which can ‘skate’ across the record. This will scratch the record and skip your audio.If you are getting into vinyl and looking for a starting turntable, do not resort to this line of tables. They will ruin your records and turn you off to the hobby. Invest in a solid, study, reliable turntable.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 17, 2020
CommentsContent: Sound isn’t very great. My portable speakers are much louder and clearer, and the records skip horribly even brand new ones. Have had it for over a year and I never use it because it’s more annoying than not.

CommentsTitle: If it's not spinning check the belt
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2019
CommentsContent: It was hard to get working, if it's not spinning when you turn it on to play the record then you need to check under that tray and make sure the belt is aligned. there's youtube videos on it also, good record player overall though. Should have came ready to play instead of me having to almost take it apart to get it to work.

CommentsTitle: Good quality and can't beat the price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2020
CommentsContent: Bought this as a gift and the recipient loved it. She already has Bluetooth speakers so she doesn't use that feature heavily, but she enjoys playing vinyls and she really liked the Union Jack design on it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 29, 2018
CommentsContent: Be aware the Bluetooth is not how you might think. I incorrectly thought this would pair with a better speaker however this is the server side so you can pair a different device to this and use it as the speaker. To play thru home theater I had to use RCA CABLES.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2021
CommentsContent: EASY set up! Plugged into my JBL portable speaker, sound is perfection! I had no idea it would work so well.

The speakers are fine but I'll likely add some better speakers just to get a more complex sound from it.

CommentsContent: I got this for my daughter for Christmas. She likes it although it skipped very badly outnof the box even on new records. Taping a dime to the top of the needle arm added enough weight to keep it from skipping.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 21, 2020
CommentsContent: Loud hum if connected to external speaker, internal speaker awful. I have 10.00 Bluetooth speakers that sound better. They can do pretty nice things in this price range, although was not expecting great things for the price, this is just unusable. Maybe defective, never tried it until outside warranty. Cool looking and concept great!

CommentsTitle: Works well. Easy to use even for someone who hasn’t used one before
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 26, 2021
CommentsContent: Bought as a gift for my 17 yr old who loves old music and has never owned a record. Set up was easy and the sound is surprisingly good.

CommentsTitle: One cannot use bluetooth headphones or speakers to play records.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2020
CommentsContent: One cannot use bluetooth headphones or speakers to play records.  One can only use the speakers on the Victrola to play music from another device.

CommentsTitle: The speed on these is messed up.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2019
CommentsContent: We only played this for a few days and then the speed changed and we had to play a 33 rpm album at 45 rpm and then it went downhill from there. Started skipping too.  Beautiful cover and we are heartbroken the quality is so bad.  Great idea.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2021

CommentsTitle: Record player of wonder and whimsy

It moves to much to were I feel its very delicate but maybe some Krazy glue will help. Other then that good quality item, looks amazing has multiple features. Not to heavy, pretty light I do wanna switch out the speakers but we'll see.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2020
CommentsContent: This is a fantastic, inexpensive, “starter” record player. The sound is lovely and it’s quite easy to use.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2020

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 26, 2020

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2018

CommentsTitle: Vinyl is making a come back.

Don't waste your money, get something that'll be stable and produce better sound than a $10 Walmart Bluetooth speaker.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2021
CommentsContent: The cord that came with the player absolutely did not work. Now hunting for a replacement.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2019

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 30, 2019
CommentsContent: The sound is good and I love the color that’s why I got it. However, the body and knobs area is lifting from the box. I didn’t notice this since I bought it a month ago and just started using it today. It works but if this is common then it’s not a great quality.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2020
CommentsContent: Got this for my 12 year old for christmas. Figured it would be a good starter player. And I was right. She loves it. Could be a bit louder but the sound quality is perfect and she can take it wherever she wishes. Good find for a great price

CommentsContent: Very good for the price. The only thing bad is the belt slips sometimes, and it's a pain to reinstall. But overall...this makes a GREAT starter vinyl player. The default speaker sound is okay, but external speakers make it sound much more clearer.

CommentsTitle: Avoid poor quality and no support/warranty
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 19, 2020
CommentsContent: Died after using it once in the first 90 days. Company will not honor warranty despite their claims here and in the manual. Support won’t respond to emails or phone calls.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 7, 2017

Overall rating is a 3, it's nice to play my collection of original records.

CommentsTitle: I have a couple vintage records from the 60s/70s that work fine, but newer vinyls skip like crazy
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2018
CommentsContent: You get what you pay for. I have a couple vintage records from the 60s/70s that work fine, but newer vinyls skip like crazy. I've tested the newer vinyls on a different turntable and they work fine-- this thing is just cheap. A fix I've found is taping a penny to the arm when playing the newer vinyls-- the extra weight helps. Definitely a cute looking little record player, but if you're looking to collect vinyl records just save up and get yourself a better player.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 20, 2018
CommentsContent: this turntable isn't for audiophiles... it's fine if you're spinning old records at your bbq parties, but if you are looking for something to last for a bit under regular use, this is not it... inital quality is good but it quickly declines... within 2 months of light use (only a couple records per week), the speed noticeably slowed and the power/speaker volume switch is very touchy... also will not play 180g vinyl due to no balance weights on tone arm...i can't recommend this because if you spend $20 more, you can likely get something a lot better...

CommentsTitle: Not bad, but not good either.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 11, 2017
CommentsContent: Right out of the box mine had arrived sadly arrived broken. The turn table wouldn't spin and it wasn't picking up anything from the stylus. I tried out the AUX and blue tooth connection and they worked alright. The speakers are tinny sounding and have no bass to them, and I'm pretty sure its playing in mono.After taking it apart and fixing the problem, which was an issue with a really cheap connector, I got the record player working. The sounds was the same as with the AUX or blue tooth inputs but it does wobble a little. The record player parts are also very plasticy and cheap feeling.Not a bad machine for basically $40 but I do expect brand new items to arrive working...

CommentsTitle: You get what you pay for...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2018
CommentsContent: Received this record player today. Although shipping was fast, that's really the only positive. My first concern was that immediately upon opening the outer Amazon box (which didn't have any outside damage), I saw that the manufacturer's outer box AND the record player box inside that was damaged. I don't understand why this was shipped to begin with -- this hole screams damaged item to me!?!  I've included images of this. Now, let's talk sound --  I get that it's only $50 and the sound isn't going to be superb but the sound is very hollow and tin-ny, not deep and rich. No base, all treble. The other issue is that the actual color is completely different than what is seen on Amazon and on the outside of the actual player box. And it's not because of online imagery having variances in shading/lighting, etc. What is seen on Amazon and the actual, live product packaging matches -- it's a light, vintage-era, sea foam-like turquoise. What is actually in the box is a turquoise blue. You can see the difference in the image attached. Not at all what I ordered or wanted. I will be returning and considering other players.

CommentsTitle: Doubly Defective, Cheaply Made, and Contains Lead
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 19, 2017
CommentsContent: 1. DOA. This was the main gift at a special birthday party yesterday. It was exactly what the birthday girl wanted, and she was so excited. We plugged it in: nothing. Thought the cheap power supply might be the culprit, so we went to Goodwill to find one that fit the specifications. With the new (used) power supply, the turntable began to spin, but still no audio came through the speakers. After unplugging and replugging, we found that the record player had returned to its former, completely unusable state. Very disappointing.2. When the turntable was spinning, the two records we tried wobbled, as if the mechanism were unbalanced. Neither record was warped, and we tried two just to be sure.3. After opening the box, we saw that good old warning... You know, the product contains something "known to the state of California" to cause birth defects, reproductive harm, etc. I looked back at the product page, and this warning was not posted anywhere I could see. I would not have bought it in the first place if I'd been informed of the potentially hazardous content.

CommentsTitle: Attractive price-point; lots of plastic but sounds good <UPDATED>
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2015
CommentsContent: Updated review: Nice features at price-point; newly received "black" model arrived in good shape and has a feature that the blue one didn't -- the volume/power knob also turns on the bluetooth discovery function whereas the blue unit had a separate switch for the bluetooth. I like the black model's design, one less switch to break and more straightforward to sync.  Sound is good but not great (as expected from two small built-in speakers), stereo sound is evident.  I like that this model stops the turntable automatically when arm at end of record (no auto return of arm), another portable unit I have does not do this. Solid four stars now for product, one start missing due to poor assembly on first model and inconvenience of needing replaced (unit very "plasticy", could have used more metal and less plastic on some parts to inspire confidence that it will last a long time). OLD REVIEW FOLLOWS: Ordered light blue model, arrived by Prime as expected.  Box in decent shape, but the item arrived defective (poorly manufactured).  One screw missing from top deck, one other screw had completely come out of top deck and was jammed under turntable (no evidence of shipping damage -- my guess is screws were stripped when installed and simply fell out during shipping -- though who knows where the second screw went?).  Something heavy has come loose inside of the turntable cabinet and slides back and forth upon tipping, presumably once held in place by one or more of the same missing screws.  The turntable functions well enough despite missing/loose components (one speaker not working) that I'm willing to give it another shot with a replacement... though the blue one is now backordered until after Christmas. Amazon Customer Support was great re. replacement options, trying again with a black one.
